Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist
Episode 10: Does Board Game News Exist?
Episode 33 : Gencon 2016 Recap + Interview with Ryan Bruns (Mayday Games)
Episode 46 :: SaltCon Recap - The Grimm Forest Kickstarter Preview
Episode 74- Antarctica
MN 0042 Light Pirate Games
The Dice Steeple Episode #14 Is Luck Really Luck?
The Game Pit: Episode 46 - Council Chamber: Big Episode on Small Games

149156.name: Castles
149156.description:
In the game of CASTLES, two players compete across the gaming table to build a Kingdom of cards.

As each player takes a turn drawing from the deck, you'll seek to gather the support of Dukes, Counts and Barons while also attracting Champions and Wizards to your Court. As you rise in power, your Nobles acquire Lands and Serfs, you'll add a Wife and Heir to your throne and move slowly toward becoming the most powerful Kingdom in the land. But wait... your opponent works to undo all you've built! You face opposition from his Minions, Magick spells and Armies. You are forced to Wage War with your Generals and Arms to seal your legacy in stone.

In the end, only one CASTLE can prevail!

Fast paced and fun, the game is quick to learn but challenging to play. While a session can be over in as little as 30 minutes, aggressive play and thoughtful strategy will keep you on the edge of your seat in game after game!

Players take turns drawing from a deck of 168 cards. As the game progresses, players may decide to try to Block their opponent’s next card draw by using the combined values of either Minions/Magick or Champions/Arms. As players gain more cards in their Kingdom, they may decide to wage war with their Army, attempting to destroy their opponent’s Kingdom while delaying paths to victory.

During the game:
The players will be building their own Kingdoms while attempting to hinder their opponent's progress by waging war or blocking their draws. Striking a balance of building, organizing, blocking and attacking is integral to victory!

During a turn, A player may perform one of five available actions.
1. Draw a card from the deck
2. Wage war against their opponent by combining the strength of their General, Champion and Arms
3. Use a Wizard card's ability
4. Top off a stack (move one card in any stack to the top of the pile)
5. Move the top card in a stack from one column to another, left or right

After completing an action, the player may opt to block their opponent's draw by combining either their Minion/Magick or Champion/Arms values. Three block conditions can occur based on the opponent's card draw value:
1. Lower value than the block total - drawn card is discarded
2. Equal value - both the drawn card and all blocking cards are discarded
3. Higher value - Drawn card is kept. Blocking cards and additional cards (equaling or exceeding the drawn value) are discarded

To Win the Game:
Be the first player to complete their Kingdom, consisting of 18 total cards in a specific arrangement.

149157.name: DreadBall: Kalimarin Ancients Nameless
149157.description:
The Nameless are a 3rd Season alien expansion team for DreadBall, the futuristic sports game. This team features slimy aquatic aliens from several apparently different but symbiotic species cooperating to play DreadBall.

The team expansion introduces 8 player models including:

4 x Nameless Strikers
2 x Nameless Guards (Hard)
2 x Nameless Guards (Sticky)

"The Nameless Confederation is home to many related species living in harmony. The Ancients reflect this in their playing style, each player working closely with his team-mates to achieve victory."

149158.name: DreadBall: Koeputki Kolossals Zees
149158.description:
The Koeputki Kolossals Zees are a 3rd Season expansion team for DreadBall, the Futuristic Sports Game. They team comprises several identical chimpanzee (hence the name 'Zee') clones.

Each basic 'Zee' team has 10 Jacks, fielding no strikers or guards. The Zees rely on mischief and mayhem on the field in order to stay competitive with stronger, faster and more skilled teams.

"Don’t be fooled by the fact that they’re genetically modified monkey clones – the Kolossals’ underhanded antics make for great entertainment, to the delight of their fans..."

149160.name: Infraction
149160.description:
The year is 2025, and the war on crime is all but lost. The streets are filled with fear as abandoned buildings and darkened alleyways haunt the imaginations of the few innocent citizens brave enough to remain. Gunfire echoes across the cities as gang violence brings vast urban decay. The global war between the Mafia and Triad syndicates has brought civil society to its knees. The fate of the criminal world is to be decided by the force you can muster and economies you can develop in the ultimate crime war that is: INFRACTION.

Game play consists of hiring mercenaries and building developments. Each player is trying to kill the other's boss. Using mercenaries to attack, and developments to gain riches, as well as the odd trick 'o' trade, they try to dominate the board in the hope of wounding the enemy boss. The game starts with each player drawing cards and using a family bank balance as a kickstart to their criminal empire. From here you build your syndicate over the course of the game.

149161.name: Heroes of Ahlmeran
149161.description:
Heroes of Ahlmeran (HoA) is a cooperative card game where 2 - 5 players come together and build an adventuring party from unique Hero Cards and Feat Cards and then complete Quests to help the land of Ahlmeran. The game requires both team strategy and problem solving abilities.

As the players, you will build your party from a selection of 12 Heroes spanning across 6 Races. The Humans, lost among the land now, with no real home. The Dwarves, at home among the rock with their advanced technology. Elves, Cast out by their past mistake, they are no longer rulers of the land but rather 2nd class citizens. The Canin, a proud race resembling a blue wolf. The Puar, the cat people of Guuman. And then the Gnomes. No one knows magic more intimately.

From those races you will select of the 6 Classes that best suits your play style. Artificer, master of artifacts and arcane knowledge. Barbarian, nomad tribes bestowing their nature knowledge and sheer might to the people. Elemental Mage, master of the 4 elements. Priest, Master of the holy arts, both offensive and defensive. Ranger, commander of nature and all that resides within her. And Templar, defender of the people, master of arcane. Each of the classes come with bonuses and a unique 40 card deck that your character will use.

Then, you select a Location Deck to play with, a deck of 15 cards to represent where your quest takes place.

Finally, you pick a Quest Deck, the enemy or circumstance your heroes are struggling against. It could be anything from breaking a curse, thwarting a thief to facing a brutal goblin ambush!

Over the course of the game, you will play cards from your Class Deck, working together with your friends to complete whatever the Quest Deck requires for your victory.

With each Quest Deck completed and Location Deck explored, you gain the chance to accumulate more rare items, allowing you to play the game countless times with more combinations than we can count

149162.name: A Thousand Leaves
149162.description:
A mythico-historical card game based on 1000 cards that weave an edutaining spell through the looking glass of time.

This is a game of history, drama and mystery made from 1000 unique Cards, each inspired by special parts of history. It may be played by 2 people, although the game is ideally played with 4-6 participants. The title evokes the oldest known Japanese poetry anthology, Ten Thousand Leaves, which transferred many oral poetry traditions to paper for the first time in the 8th Century. A Thousand Leaves is also a translation of “Chiba”, a region in Japan.

Every player is a Leader of one of the 8 Realms. The game takes place in Turns, each of which consists of 4 PHASES: Diplomatic, Military, Society and Spirit. In each Phase, each player may take one free Action (“Phase Action”). Armies may traverse the globe or Priests build Temples, units turn against their masters or debates alter the fate of nations.

The game also features a representation of ancient warfare, complete with a Center, Left and Right and real battlefield strategies. Each player takes an action through pieces (Face Cards) on an imaginary board, alternating until all pieces have taken at least one action before the next turn begins.

149163.name: Sticks and Stones
149163.description:
Sticks and Stones is a fun, strategic card game, that gives you the power to choose your path to victory.

In S&S you will:

-Battle your opponent through the use of characters, enhancements, vehicles, heroes, and creatures!

-Beef up your characters with potions, special abilities, magic, and more!

-Crush your enemy using brute force, or a more tactical approach!

S&S has:

-Unique, and crazy cool artwork!

-Custom die for tracking progress!

-High quality components made to last through years of fun!

-An easy learning curve, while also giving you the option for more in depth gameplay!

How is it played?

1. Build your deck from a large selection of cool characters, crazy enhancements, and awesome creatures. Then choose your hero for the battle!

2. Obliterate your opponent! Using your deck you will Deploy>Enhance>Attack>Discard. Use ranged and melee cards to attack. Juice them up with some spells. Place in some defensive vehicles to block incoming attacks. Use counter-attack cards to send the enemies attacks right back at them!

3. After capturing the opposing hero, regroup and rebuild your deck for the next battle. Don't forget to adjust your strategy, because now your opponent will gain an advantage through the use of terrain cards! So stay alert and think outside of the box or you might be caught blindsided by a brutal attack

149165.description: Shadows over the Empire: Fallen Allies, a mini-expansion for Shadows over the Empire, consists of four C-level Leader cards, one Infatuation card (which is used by Dorian the Libertine), and rules for their use.
149165.name: Shadows over the Empire: Fallen Allies

rpgitemversion: Périlleuses Alliances - le manuel des mercenaires
149166.name: Dangerous Covenants
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
rpgpodcastepisode: Tales From the Hydian Way: Hiring Guns
149166.description:
From the publisher's webpage:
At the Edge of the Empire, you can find yourself pitted against an array of deadly enemies bent on your destruction. When negotiations fail, make sure you’re prepared to shoot first with Dangerous Covenants!

This upcoming rules supplement for Star Wars: Edge of the Empire expands the Hired Gun career with specializations, new talents, and more. All players will find new character, vehicle, and equipment options, aiding in their experiences on the fringe. GMs can also find new tools helping them craft memorable and exciting combat encounters.

149167.name: Path of Dice
149167.description:
In Path of Dice the goal is to create a connected path of dice from your starting area to the opposite end of the board by placing the just-rolled dice according to a few simple rules. Your opponent is of course doing the same from the other end thus creating a lot of conflict.

It's a fun, fast, simple and surprisingly strategic game for two or four players.

A 2-player game is played in about ten minutes with strategic decisions being made on most throws.

With so many dice being rolled luck does play a big part in who wins the game. But the strategic depth of the game could still surprise its creator even after 50+ played games.

149168.description: This is a set of promotional dice given out at GenCon 2013 at the Warp Speed Charity Event sponsored by Mayfair Games. The competitors competed in a single elimination tournament and the three finalists competed against Wil Wheaton on a giant-sized Star Trek: Catan board. The funds raised by the event went to charity.
149168.name: Star Trek: Catan – Promotional Dice

149169.description:
Set in a steampunk universe, Heavy Steam is a game about piloting a giant mechanical humanoid war machine of doom. As a pilot you use the steam titan’s resources to strategically complete scenario objectives. More often than not it’s to defeat your opponent, but you’ve never shied away from a fight, have you?

--In Heavy Steam you play the role of a pilot controlling your steam titan’s systems from the command center inside its head.
--Fully customize your steam titan: choose a robot, recruit your pilot, then customize with weapons of your choice.
--Plan ahead if you want to power your legs, weapons or other systems.
--The battle board is abstracted with easy to master combat.
--Event cards, terrain cards and other cards keep the game fresh and new every time you play.

Play through a variety of focused scenarios or just battle it out until only the champion remains! With several game modes from which to choose, you always face another challenging battle ahead – will you take up the call?
149169.name: Heavy Steam
boardgamepodcastepisode: Gen Con pt. 2, Heavy Steam by Greenbrier Games - Boards & Swords #46

149170.name: Table Pack 15: The Champion Pub and Whirlwind
149170.description:
User Summary:

This pack adds recreations of two pinball tables to Pinball Arcade.

The Champion Pub was released in 1998 by Bally. It is set in a backstreet pub playing host to a boxing ring. The theme is around training your boxer, earning jewels on your belt, defeating opponents in the ring, and aiming to win the Pub Championship. You train by completing tasks such as the jump rope, the speed bag and the heavy bag. When having reached a high-enough life level from training, the Heavy Bag rotates to reveal the head of your opponent. Defeating the opponent is achieved by hitting him in the body, or by launching off ramps to hit him in the head until his life is reduced to zero. Other hits can be achieved by scoring combos off the various ramps.

Whirlwind was released in 1990 by Williams and is themed around storm-chasers. The original table included a fan which blowed in the player's face when the storm starts picking up. The playfield includes three rotating discs, which can throw the ball in unexpected directions, and six jet bumpers, which also add a high degree of randomness - perfectly complementing the theme of the table. The primary aim of the game is to activate Feel The Power Multiball by locking two balls. In order to activate the locks, various storm and navigation themed activities need to be completed.

149171.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 46 - Oct 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Active Measures: The Color of Monks' Robes
Doing It My Way: A System for Character Improvement
Doing It My Way: The Ship’s Locker: Limiting Without Specifying
In A Store Near You: Cargo Lifter
In A Store Near You: Holmes-class Air/Raft
In A Store Near You: Luderitz-class Undersea Mining Trawler
Kurishdam: Jump Destination: Tanna-Sheru, Alkaidin System
Raconteurs’ Rest: Drop Out, Part Twenty Five
149171.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #046: October 2013

Cover: NASA

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller's web site.

149172.name: Smack Down
149172.description:
Juego de tablero para varios jugadores inspirado en el wrestling, en concreto en la WWE, editado y creado en España.
Cada jugador representa un luchador, y debe lograr ser el único que quede con puntos de vida sobre el ring.
Para ello usaran cartas que podrán usar para atacar o defenderse.


Inspired by wrestling, specifically WWE, edited and created in Spain.

Each player takes a fighter, an energy marker, and 50 random cards. In turn a player will take a card and roll a die to advance. When all players are in the ring, a player may start a fight against an opponent. Cards are used to attack or defend. The game ends when there is only one player with energy.

149173.description:
“There are only five of us now, three of us didn’t make it when we ran into them on the other side of the stream. None of us wants to think that they are following us, mindless, only wanting to feast on our flesh, but we cannot stop thinking of the horror behind us.
We are all shocked and exhausted but we must keep going. The trees are thinning out and I can see lights ahead… we’ve almost made it… A farm surrounded by bushes but with lights on, there must be other survivors there. No, not bushes – the house is surrounded by dozens of zombies, trying to break in. I can hear their moans even this far away, they sound so close.
They are among the trees. Shambling over dead wood, we are surrounded…”

7ombieTV is a standalone Zombie horror spinoff from acclaimed spy-fi miniatures game 7TV. It is the 1980s, and the dead have risen with terrifying amounts of gore and a fearsome appetite for your flesh! Only with a bold heart and a large amount of unlikely weaponry can you survive the night…

Players make their force spending points and following rules on the number of heroes and sheep they can have as there are three levels of characters. The game is won when one side completes the objective, points can be scored for other task completed during the game such as killing of zombies! Elements can be used in the 7TV games if desired.
149173.name: 7ombieTV

149176.name: Inspector Parker
149176.description:
Help solve the mystery of Misanthrope Manor in the whodunit puzzler, Inspector Parker.

Sort through suspects, weapons, motives, victims, evidence, and body-disposal methods as you aide Inspector Parker in solving the crime. Choose from 10 levels of play in Career Mode, select Puzzle Mode for a game of thoughtful deduction, or move quickly as you race the clock in Timed Mode.

A download-must for all fans of board game puzzles and mysteries alike!
- Solve the mystery of Misanthrope Manor.
- Choose from 3 levels of play.
- Choose from three difficulty settings.

Source: The Publisher Website.

149178.name: DreadBall Ultimate
149178.description:
DreadBall Ultimate is an expansion for DreadBall: The Futuristic Sports Game. This boxed expansion includes a Season 3 rulebook (available separately); Four Giant MVPs; a durable non-slip rubber gaming mat to represent the game field; a DreadBall Ultimate card deck; and a DreadBall Ultimate counter sheet.

DreadBall Ultimate allows up to 6 players to face off on an expanded game pitch. DreadBall is hectic enough facing just one opponent. Face the mayhem of competing against up to 5 other players!

149179.name: Hey, Fatso
149179.description:
This is a talking children's boardgame. This is a roll-and-move game with cards. The theme of the game is eating.

The object is to be the first one to get rid of all of your food cards.

149181.name: Swords & Potions
149181.description:
User Summary

You are the proud owner of a merchant shop in the town of Tomagar. You craft a variety of items and sell them to adventurers for profit. Hire employees to help you, undertake an array of quests, use various covert operations and gain levels so as to create more powerful items. Your ultimate goal is to surpass your peers and become the most successful merchant in the world of Tomagar.

149182.name: Swords & Potions 2
149182.description:
User Summary

In the sequel to Swords & Potions, you once more run a shop in a small town. You also have complete control over everything. You can design and customize your store, hire employees and buy an array of improvements. Trading with other players and undertaking a variety of quests are two additional options. Your ultimate goal is to become the most successful craftsman and merchant.

149183.name: Magic 2014 - Duels of the Planeswalkers: Expansion
149183.description:
User Summary

The expansion for Magic 2014 - Duels of the Planeswalkers adds more of the same, with five new decks to unlock, five new challenges, and a new campaign to play through. The campaign's plot involves searching for ingredients for an immortality spell.

149184.name: Junior Bombsight Game
149184.description:
Player uses a cardboard "bombsite" to drop marble bombs on "flip" targets in the box for up to 1000 points. Perfect score is 3150 points.

Unit is self contained. Lid of box is lifted off containing the flip target display. Player stands over the box dropping the black marble "bombs" using the provided "bombsite" marble tube.

Method and "bombsite" actually work very well!! "Bombsite is made like a pair of binoculars with a tube attached. When adjusted they actually display an X to site over the "target" and drop the marble from the attached tube. All made of heavy cardboard!!

149185.name: Dark Darker Darkest: Light in the Dark Expansion
149185.description:
This expansion to Dark Darker Darkest adds Glow in the Dark zombies to the base game. A total of 40 glow-in-the-dark zombies is included:


10 Guts zombies
10 Chunk zombies
10 Disco Doll zombies
10 Tuff Guy zombies


This expansion was advertised as introducing a new scenario and new zombie abilities to the base game and having additional tokens and rules to use the glow in the dark zombies. However, the game ended up shipping with nothing but glow in the dark figures.

The grey version of these zombie figures are included in the Dark Darker Darkest: Zombie Expansion (2013).

149186.description:
This expansion to Dark Darker Darkest adds RadioactiveRed zombies and introduces a new scenario and new zombie abilities to the base game. Note that Dark Darker Darkest: Kickstarter Special already included a playable version on this expansion but did not include any of the "RadioactiveRed" creature or zombie miniatures.

It contains:

66 RadioactiveRed Miniatures (7 survivors [with colored bases], 4 nemeses, 5 creatures, and 50 zombies [10 of each of Standards, Guts, Disco Dolls, Chunk, and Tuff Guy])
10 Expansion Specific Equipment Cards
1 Reactor Room Tile
27 Radiation Markers
Rulebooks (1 English, 1 German, and 1 Spanish)
149186.name: Dark Darker Darkest: Radioactive Expansion

149187.name: 16-Bit RPG: The Board Game
149187.description:
Long ago, in a decade not so far away, there existed video games so legendary their legacies carry on to this very day.

16-Bit RPG: The Board Game is exactly that: a board game that pays homage to a time period in video game history gone by. A period that holds a very special place in the hearts of many!

Collect loot, gear your character, use skills, fight monsters and progress through the world until you’re ready to take on one of the mighty Final Bosses!

- Classic RPG styled pixel art
- Easy to learn loot collecting board game
- Skills and Events offer variance in each game

Gameplay

During Your Turn you roll the dice and move the spaces to see what happend; like finding loot, entering on a market or fighting a monster! You use your cards to deal with the adventures by equiping wargear or using items like potions.
You play until one player gets to defeat the final boss.

149188.name: Angelica Weaver: Catch Me When You Can
149188.description:
Angelica Weaver, a detective on Chicago's Special Task Force, must use her renowned deductive skills to stop a present day killer. The only way for her to get ahead of this killer is to first identify a murderer who escaped justice over a hundred years ago. Angelica has the ability to connect with the dead. Through supersensory visions she is able to jump back and forth between crimes scenes on the streets of historic London and present-day Chicago where the victims reveal to her their final moments. Work with Angelica as she puzzles her way through the past and uses her insights to stop the pattern in the future in this crime-adventure drama.

Source: The Developer Website.

149190.name: Incursion 2: The Artifact
149190.description:
User Summary

Dark enemies are on the attack yet again and you are called to take defensive positions and save the realm. Use the preset barracks wisely and generate footmen, archers and wizards. The units can be upgraded and moved to ideal positions around the battlefield for optimum effectiveness. Your most powerful unit, your hero can deliver massive amounts of damage and can also be upgraded.

149191.description: The expansion Qin: Toad and Dragon Turtle Game Boards consists of a double-sided game board that you can use with the Qin base game. On the "Dragon Turtle" side of the game board, players must build around a massive mountain range, while the "Toad" board offers more starting positions as well as paddy fields that make the villages less accessible.
149191.name: Qin: Toad and Dragon Turtle Game Boards
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ39: Recomanacions nadalenques 2013
Garrett's Games 404 - Expansions of Qin and Village

149192.name: Modern Magic Items VI
149192.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is it- our last modern magic Buck-A-Batch! Creation's Edge Games brings you another batch of fifty new magic items with a contemporary slant. Here's a collection of commonplace items with not so common abilities:

Blackmail Kit, Fragazine, Glass Suit, and the Red Plastic Cup to name a few.

The Buck-A-Batch line is part of System 20, a design your own supplement system created by Creation's Edge Games.

149193.name: The Rogue's Guide to Capers
149193.description:
From publisher blurb:

What does a character do in between adventures? Wizards research new spells. Clerics continue praying for divine favors. Warriors train with weapons and armor. Rogues...sharpen their daggers? Rogues are capable of so much and yet continue to have their abilities usurped by the bard and even the alchemist. This pdf allows rogues to flex their keen abilities off-screen to do what they're best at--gathering wealth!

The Rogue's Guide to Capers provides a quick system for dealing with how a PC rogue will spend his down time. Maybe he needs some quick coin by betting on a sure thing or wants to establish a long-term wealth source by wooing a baroness. Seven sample jobs are provided as are rules for the amount of wealth a rogue can acquire depending on the community size he is operating within.

149194.name: Double Shot Solos Volume Two
149194.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Shot Solos are beginner solo adventures for the QADD:Quick and Dirty Dungeons RPG system. You will need the QADD rules to play.

The Duchy of the Drakes and A Princess To Be Saved... were written origanlly for Tunnels & Trolls. They have been slightly modified to be adapted to QADD. Both are extremely short and meant for 10-15 minutes of play.

149195.name: In The Company of Fey (Pathfinder)
149195.description:
From publisher blurb:

Come and delight in the mess you make of mortal lives!

The First Folk, servants of Auberyon the Solstice King, they are race of mercurial essence and yet they are timeless, a race that cares very little for the consequences of their actions yet they keep the bargains that they make. They are the uncaring eldritch powers of nature, yet they are quick to take offense, all the while living with abandonment. They value entertainment, humor, and take on the aspects of various forms throughout their immortal existence.

Create the fey you want to play in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. This product includes the new race The First Folk, alternate racial traits, favored class bonuses, two new archetypes as well as the Fey Racial Paragon class. In the Company of Fey gives you everything you need to fully integrate this new racial culture into established campaigns and bring their society to life as told to you in first person by Red Shuck of the First Folk.

Don’t wait! Bring this legendary race into your game and show the world what they Fey can do!

149196.name: The Miller's Tale
149196.description:
Publisher' blurb:


Something is rotten in the village of Jib’s Hollow and it’s not just the local weaver’s aversion to bathing. When a despairing ghost calls for justice can the heroes find his murderer before more people die?


A murder mystery scenario to challenge a group of Dragon Warriors characters of 2nd to 5th rank.

149197.name: The World Beneath the Clouds
149197.description:
From publisher blurb:

How great would be the desire in every admirer of nature be to view, if such were possible, the scenery of another planet? Charles Darwin

Venus in 1883 has much to admire, and much to fear as well. Explorers of that world would be well advised to read this volume. In it they will find the details of climate, culture and creatures of that mysterious planet. Prepare yourself for a voyage through airless space aboard a Ewing and Stuart powered liner. make landfall by gliding down to the salt flats of Equatoria. Outfit your party in the shops of the International City. Learn of the deadly Sea Kings and the even more dangerous seas upon which they sail. Barter with the most greedy merchants in the solar system, the Naxlii, or explore the cloud forests with warriors of the Cloud Kingdoms.

This source book for Stars of Empire will give game masters and players enough material for numberless adventures or campaigns. New rules cover the differences between characters raised on Earth and those born on Venus. Some of the deadliest creatures of Venus are described and the ecology of the world is well documented. This source book can be used for any campaign thats seeks a well detailed and unique setting for planetary adventures.

149199.name: Prowlers & Paragons Core Rules
149199.description:
From publisher blurb:


Welcome to Prowlers & Paragons!

Prowlers & Paragons (or P&P) is a tabletop roleplaying game with a narration-driven, rules-light system designed to emulate four-color superhero comics. Let’s break that down so you can see what you’re getting yourself into.

P&P is a tabletop roleplaying game. We’re going to assume you’ve got this one covered.

P&P is a narration-driven system. The rules in this game are not effects driven. For the most part, they don’t tell you what happens. Instead, they tell you who gets to describe what happens. And that’s what it’s all about in P&P: describing what happens. Both the players and the gamemaster (GM) take turns narrating events in the game world. This makes P&P feel more like an exercise in collaborative storytelling than a typical roleplaying game. However, P&P isn’t totally freeform and open-ended either. There are rules that help determine what characters can do and how they compare to one another, especially in combat! This prevents the game from devolving into a never-ending debate about what is and isn’t reasonable.

P&P is rules light. It’s chock full of gross oversimplifications and blatant inaccuracies that mimic comic book tropes rather than real-world facts. This also makes P&P a simple game with a streamlined set of rules. Once you know what you’re doing, you should be able to play without ever opening the book.

Finally, P&P is designed to emulate four-color superhero comics. This game is about the heroic things the characters do and the heroic burdens they shoulder. Mundane matters get little attention. There aren’t any detailed rules for dealing with money and wealth, but there most definitely is a rule for smashing into a bank vault. Let’s be perfectly clear: This is not a deep and cerebral game. P&P was designed to let you play stories about super heroes who save the world and beat the snot out of villains who richly deserve it. Like so much of the genre, P&P is a gleefully unapologetic exercise in heroic wish fulfillment.


Core Rules!

The core rules are finally here!

Included here are 2 versions of the game, one in full beautiful color and one with crisp, black-and-white line art so that your printer won't break up with you for printing it out. Both are 142 pages long and include:

Chapter 1: Introduction: Um ... it's an introduction. What did you expect?

Chapter 2: Action: This chapter include most of the rules you need to play the game, including rules for narrative task resolution and comic book slugfests!

Chapter 3: Characters: Here is where you learn how to make heroes! We have full character creation rules that allow you to create street level prowlers, cosmic paragons, and everything in between.

Chapter 4: Heroism: This chapter explains the use of Resolve and Adversity, the narrative currency that players and gamemasters use to bend the rules of the game and even the game world itself in their favor.

Chapter 5: Wonderful Toys: You like gear? Then this is the chapter for you. This chapter includes weapons, armor, miscellaneous equipment, vehicles (and yes, vehicle combat rules), and even rules for creating your own makeshift items on the fly in the middle of a story. What could possibly go wrong?

Chapter 6: Big Bad World: It's a big world full of bad stuff that give heroes headaches. Disasters, Diseases, Hazards ... ther're all in here.

Chapter 7: Friends & Foes: A veritable rogues gallery at your disposal. A host of mundane (and not so mundane) npcs, from Athletes to Zombies, a large number of animals from Bats to Zebras (yes, of course there are dinosaurs in there), and a collection of archetypal supers from the Acrobat to the Weather Controller that you can used as villains, or even as heroes if you're in a rush.

Chapter 8: Playing the Game: This chapter provides both players and gamemasters (but mostly gamemasters) with tools, tips, and tricks for running the best super hero roleplaying game they can run. We give you our thoughts about playing and running roleplaying games while desperately trying not to sound patronizing.

Chapter 9: From the Ashes: A light-hearted (and rather forgiving) introductory adventurefor a group of heroes of standard power level.


The world needs heroes.


Take a Stand! Join the Fight!


BE A HERO!

149200.name: Liber Vampyr: Secrets of the Blood (Revised)
149200.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be the Thing that Goes “Bump” in the Night

For years, the legend of the vampire has captivated the minds of mortals, and these dark stalkers of the night have become permanent fixtures of fantasy media and roleplaying games alike. But while vampires in novels, movies, and television each provide their own unique twist or spin on the vampire myth, creating innumerable different interpretations of what it means to be a vampire, for the Pathfinder roleplaying game, at least, there is only one kind of vampire, which fits some styles of vampirism well, and doesn’t fit others at all. Even worse for vampire enthusiasts, the ability to actually play as one of these nocturnal lurkers is incredibly limited.

In March of 2010, the original Liber Vampyr: Secrets of the Blood attempted to address these issues by creating a new kind of vampire for the Pathfinder roleplaying game: the revenant. Designed to be a player character race and intended to have access to a wide array of different vampiric “blood powers,” Liber Vampyr invited players to build their own vampire, based on whatever interpretation of vampires they preferred, and was fully designed with vampire player characters in mind, allowing them to progress through their vampiric power the same way that a sorcerer progresses through arcane magic.

To date, over 150,000 copies of the original Liber Vampyr have been downloaded. But despite its popularity, we felt that we could make it better. The new version of Liber Vampyr has been redesigned from the ground up to be more intuitive and easy to use, as well as to improve player experience. Virtually every part of the book has been rewritten in order to affect this change, and the result is an entirely new monster that can still provide fun and excitement campaign after campaign.

149201.name: Explorer
149201.description:
From publisher blurb:

An expert on the occult, and how does one say it… obtainer of rare antiquities.

The Explorer, a full 20-level class for Labyrinth Lord (and other old-school fantasy role-playing games) is ready to brave whatever mysteries the dungeons of the world may offer! Whether its lost languages, strange incantations or mysterious cults, they're ready for anything!

149202.description:
Fantasy Flight Games is proud to announce resin House cards for each of the six Great Houses represented in A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! Now you can boldly state your allegiance for your favorite House by displaying its heraldry and claiming power on a stylish resin House card as you battle your way to the Iron Throne.

Flaunt Your Heraldry

As you engage in the fierce battles and twisted intrigues of Westeros, you can collect power on a House card bearing the direwolf of House Stark, the lion of House Lannister, or the three-headed dragon of House Targaryen. Perhaps you will exhibit the crowned stag of House Baratheon or the sun-and-spear of House Martell, or even the fearsome kraken of House Greyjoy. No matter which House you support on the field of battle, these resin House cards will serve you well.
boardgameaccessory: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
149202.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – House Baratheon Resin Card

149203.description:
Fantasy Flight Games is proud to announce resin House cards for each of the six Great Houses represented in A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! Now you can boldly state your allegiance for your favorite House by displaying its heraldry and claiming power on a stylish resin House card as you battle your way to the Iron Throne.

As you engage in the fierce battles and twisted intrigues of Westeros, you can collect power on a House card bearing the direwolf of House Stark, the lion of House Lannister, or the three-headed dragon of House Targaryen. Perhaps you will exhibit the crowned stag of House Baratheon or the sun-and-spear of House Martell, or even the fearsome kraken of House Greyjoy. 149206.description:
