No matter which House you support on the field of battle, these resin House cards will serve you well.

Also included in A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Kings of the Sea.
boardgameaccessory: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
149206.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – House Greyjoy Resin Card

149207.description:
Fantasy Flight Games is proud to announce resin House cards for each of the six Great Houses represented in A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! Now you can boldly state your allegiance for your favorite House by displaying its heraldry and claiming power on a stylish resin House card as you battle your way to the Iron Throne.

As you engage in the fierce battles and twisted intrigues of Westeros, you can collect power on a House card bearing the direwolf of House Stark, the lion of House Lannister, or the three-headed dragon of House Targaryen. Perhaps you will exhibit the crowned stag of House Baratheon or the sun-and-spear of House Martell, or even the fearsome kraken of House Greyjoy. No matter which House you support on the field of battle, these resin House cards will serve you well.
boardgameaccessory: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
149207.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – House Targaryen Resin Card

149208.name: Elephonkey
149208.description:
From the box back:

ELEPHONKEY The game where the truth has a major deficit

Everybody’s full of Elephonkey in this not-really-political party game!

Play your hand and lay down your cards, announcing their ranks… are you gonna tell the truth? Maybe… and maybe not! Donkeys, Elephants, Tree-Huggers and Tea Partiers are the “suits” and there are a couple special interest porkers mixed in.

If you think somebody’s lying about the cards they play, shout, “ELEPHONKEY!” Be first to get rid of your cards and you’ll have a landslide victory!

149209.name: The Half-Set Sun
149209.description:
From the Kickstarter:

The Nubians attack along the distant fortresses south of sun-scorched Egypt. Your century has been ordered to take back the Empire's fortresses and protect the villages. But what caused this sudden invasion? Does something lurk in the sands, calling these two mighty empires to bloody war?

The Half Set Sun is a 23-page adventure for Weird Wars: Rome. Players take on the role of a Centurion and command an entire century as they battle over the fortresses and villages of the Aegyptian outlands.

149210.name: NorthCoast Roleplaying (Issue 1 - 1987)
149210.description:
Quirk Skills for GURPs By Richard Leduc
Panther Assault Tank - A new Battle Tech Tank by Mel Westbrook
New Inborn Abilities for Battle Tech by Barry Osser
Whips for GURPS by Tim Morgan and Richard LeDuc
Sewers & Slimebeasts by ABE CROW
Andregu - An AD&D monster created for use by Ethan Marcus
Low Passage by Bill Burg

149211.name: Monster-Set
149211.description:
User summary:

This is a combined version of Volumes 1 and 2 of the English language version of the Monstrous Compendium, and an edited reprint of the earlier softcover Monsterkompendium I.

149213.name: Horror World (Draft v0.5)
149213.description:
designer's comment:
Inspired by Kreg Mosier's The Dead, S.P. Wipfli's DEAD MEAT, AFMBE, The Deadworld Comics, All the Romero and Russo movies, and any other Zombie Movies that I have seen. Oh and let us not forget AMC's The Walking Dead.

Original Horror World conceived back somewhere in the early 90's and long gone.

Completely easy to make a Player Victim. In fact if you are going to play make a few Victims because players die. Heroes that try and shoot every undead they see will find themselves eaten by the dead when they run out of bullets.

I have always found problems with many of the survival games out there namely complexity and long character creation then you play and die fast.

user summary:
A survival horror themed role playing game built on a simple, flexible d6-based mechanic.

149215.name: Midgard Bestiary (4E)
149215.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Midgard Bestiary for D&D is here, with more than 150 monsters and foes drawn from Open Design's award-winning adventures and sourcebooks!

Between its covers lurk some of the greatest monsters that Open Design has unleashed on players over the last five years - ready to deploy in your D&D adventures. All are core fantasy creatures designed for easy adaptation to a homebrew campaign or another published setting.

You'll find lots of old favorites here along with brand-new monsters: foes and allies from the Free City of Zobeck, the empire of the ghouls, the courts of the shadow and river fey, the Old Margreve forest, and the Ironcrags.

4th Edition D&D players now have a toychest that includes the cave dragon, steam golem, ghost knight, imperial ghast, bonepowder ghoul, roachling, plus new demons, devils, and more, all fully illustrated and heavily playtested!

149216.name: The Wayside Inn
149216.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Wayside Inn is the first stop on the road North away from the village of Solis. It is a modest two story inn that stands at a fork in the road; to the Northeast is the small village of Haven and the dark and dreary Ashen Swamp, and to the Northwest is the long abandoned road leading to a desolate region known only as "The Darkened Vale".

At the edge of of the Solis patrols, The Wayside Inn is a reasonably priced establishment with one of the most well known taverns in the region. The rooms are almost always booked, the lobby is always filled to capacity with merchants and adventurers alike, and the dwarven ale never stops flowing.

Its claim to fame is the entertainment. Known as the "Ethereal Bard", a magical device in the lobby creates an illusion of a singing musician that floods the room with uplifting and soothing music. The device can even take requests... For a fee.

The Wayside Inn is a focal point in the second act of The Coming Dark, Chapter One: Into the Light, a large scale campaign currently in development by Darklight Interactive.

You may use this map pack in any way you wish; the above is how the inn currently exists within the module The Coming Dark. What is actually inside the inn, or even what the inn is named, is entirely up to you.

This pack includes high resolution (200 DPI) images of the first and second floors of The Wayside Inn, both in full color and in "printer friendly" grayscale. Package also includes 50DPI JPEG images - black and white or color, with or without grid lines - for use in applications.

149218.name: The Ring of Stones
149218.description:
From publisher blurb:

For hundreds of years the stones stood undisturbed, encircling a clearing in the middle of a dense forest. Eight identical slabs of solid rock, towering twenty feet in to the air, anchored in to the earth in such a way that not even the strongest man could so much as budge them.

Nobody knows for sure why they are there, or even who created the circle in the first place, but many believe it's best that they remain undisturbed. Some things are best left unknown.

In recent times the world around these nondescript stones began to change. Evil began to dwell within the forest as it turned dark and foreboding. The wild became a dangerous place, claiming anyone who dared disturb it, and those that have entered it forest were never heard from again.

And, at the center of it all, stands the ring.

Who knows what secrets remain dormant, awaiting to be unlocked by those that seek to harness their power?

The Ring of Stones is a focal point in the second act of The Coming Dark, Chapter One: Into the Light, a large scale campaign currently in development by Darklight Interactive.

You may use this map pack in any way you wish; the above is how the ring currently exists within the module The Coming Dark. The true purpose of the ring is entirely up to you.

This pack includes high resolution (150 DPI) images of the ring of stones, both in full color and in desaturated grayscale. Package also includes 50DPI JPEG images - black and white or color, with or without grid lines - for use in third party applications.

149219.name: Crypt Entrance
149219.description:
From publisher blurb:

The crypt lay undisturbed for centuries. Not only was the approach wrought with peril, but the entrance was sealed off from the rest of the world by a heavy stone slab. Its mysteries lay hidden in the dark...

Only recently has a bold group of adventurers come to the crypt, pushing aside the massive stone to reveal the entrance below. Who knows what wonders - and what dangers - lie in the depths of the crypt?

The Crypt Entrance is a focal point in A Hero's Journey, a mini-adventure for level 0 characters by Darklight Interactive.

This pack includes low resolution (50 DPI) and high resolution (200 DPI) images of the entrance in full color. Package also includes images without grid lines for use in third party applications.

149220.name: Desert Tomb
149220.description:
From publisher blurb:

For almost a millenia the tomb lay buried below the sands of the vast desert of Mejdul. Now the entrance has once again been revealed and the horrors within have broken free.

Who knows what evils await inside, gathering strength to rise up and escape out in to the open air, longing for the day they can once again feast on the living? Who knows what treasures may rest with the buried kings of times past?

The Desert Tomb is a focal point in the upcoming module Return of the Crystal Scion, a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure by Darklight Interactive.

This pack includes low resolution (50 DPI) and high resolution (100 DPI) images of the tomb in full color. Package also includes images without grid lines for use in third party applications.

149221.name: Dragon's Lair
149221.description:
From publisher blurb:

This lair is the focal point of The Dragon's Master, a short delve for both Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition and the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, written by Darklight Interactive.

This pack includes four separate PDFs (scaled to a 1" grid) for different terrains - swamp, water, lava and ice - and includes high resolution (100 DPI) images of the lair in full color.

149222.name: The Dragon's Master (Pathfinder)
149222.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The Dragon's Master" is a short delve (5 encounters) for a group of of 5th-6th level characters, compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

Skeebo led a hard life. Small even by kobold standards, he was constantly mocked by the others in his clan and tormented by their leader: a black dragon named Pyraxis. Not strong enough to be useful as a soldier and not smart enough to be a mage, he was forced to do all the menial tasks that the rest of the Ashen Kobolds didn't feel like doing. And if he resisted or refused to do what he was told, he risked getting eaten by Pyraxis.

One day, while wandering about the Ashen Swamp, Skeebo made an astonishing discovery: an artifact of unprecedented power that was seemingly discarded in the muck. After donning the artifact, everything changed; he no longer was he the puny kobold that everyone picked on... It was the chance he was looking for to show the others what he was capable of, and show the other kobolds, the humans in the nearby village of Haven, and especially that big, dumb dragon who the "supreme kobold" really was.

This module is a conversion of the delve originally designed for Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition. It was first released in January 2012, but in February 2013 we realized that we did a lot of things wrong with the original version (it was our first Pathfinder product... we were new at it then). So we rebuilt the adventure - redesigning the monsters, converting the stat blocks to a more commonly accepted Pathfinder-like format, adjusting DCs and other values, and tweaking a few things here and there - and re-released it in February of 2013.

149223.name: The Dragon's Master (4E)
149223.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The Dragon's Master" is a short delve (5 encounters) for a group of of 5th-6th level characters, compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

Skeebo led a hard life. Small even by kobold standards, he was constantly mocked by the others in his clan and tormented by their leader: a black dragon named Pyraxis. Not strong enough to be useful as a soldier and not smart enough to be a mage, he was forced to do all the menial tasks that the rest of the Ashen Kobolds didn't feel like doing. And if he resisted or refused to do what he was told, he risked getting eaten by Pyraxis.

One day, while wandering about the Ashen Swamp, Skeebo made an astonishing discovery: an artifact of unprecedented power that was seemingly discarded in the muck. After donning the artifact, everything changed; he no longer was he the puny kobold that everyone picked on... It was the chance he was looking for to show the others what he was capable of, and show the other kobolds, the humans in the nearby village of Haven, and especially that big, dumb dragon who the "supreme kobold" really was.

149224.name: Items of Legend
149224.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the moment you first held it in your hands, you have become attached to your sword. You were inseparable, taking on any foe that crossed your path without hesitation. Over time the sword became an extension of yourself, and it began to give you the ability to do things most normal people could not. Without the sword you were nothing, and without you your sword was nothing, but now that the two of you have been attuned to each other after so many years, there was nothing you couldn’t do together.

Items of Legend provides a rule set and examples of items that grow in power through exposure to their owners, gaining levels in the same manner as a player character and unlocking new abilities as they progress.

This supplement includes 6 new artifacts usable by a variety of character classes (fighters, mages, bards, etc.) whose powers will expand as the players grow in levels. Each artifact comes tailored with an origin story and provides DMs at least 2 quests, including final encounters, for how to unlock the artifacts full powers; the quests include new solo monsters, skill challenges and adventure hooks the DMs can use that are based on the item’s origin story.

Items of Legend is designed to be used under the Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition rule set, and the guidelines provided here could be used at any level: from entry-level Heroic heroes to Epic demi-gods.

149225.name: The Absent-Minded Alchemist
149225.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Absent-Minded Alchemist is a short (2 encounter) side trek or delve for a group of of level 1 characters, compatible with the Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition game system. It is designed to be used at any time, and can be inserted in to any campaign if you want something to entertain the party or serve as a means of gaining more information by helping a local NPC.

The great alchemist Zaelin has made quite a reputation for himself in these parts. Although he makes quality alchemical mixtures, potions and other items he is noticeably absent-minded and, in some cases, careless about how he goes about creating these mixtures. He’s had his share of accidents, ranging from injuring half a dozen apprentices to destroying a large portion of his home.

Most recently Zaelin has gotten in to the nasty habit of disposing of his failed mixtures simply by pouring them down the drain. Over time these highly volatile mixtures have eaten through the city’s sewer system and accumulated in the ground beneath his feet. There, the other smaller residents of the city – the countless rats that live underground – have been exposed to these alchemical mixtures and have been the victims of some rather nasty side effects.

Now Zaelin has a problem: his basement is full of rats, but these aren’t the normal rats he’s use to. They have been infused with alchemical energies by his own hand, and they are too many of them for the hapless wizard to deal with himself.

If only a group of adventurers could come by and deal with the problem...

149226.name: The Festival of Magic
149226.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Festival of Magic is a short (5 encounter) mini-adventure or delve for a group of of level 1 characters, compatible with the Dungeons and Dragons 4th Edition game system. It is designed to be used at any time, and can be inserted in to any campaign set in a large city (simply change the city's name - Wildwood - for your city of choice) if you want something to entertain the party or serve as a means of gaining more information by helping the local government.

For almost a century, the city has hosted a grand convention of magic every ten years, inviting everyone from apprentices to the most powerful of wizards of the region to attend and share their knowledge and experiences amongst other practitioners of the arcane arts. It also hosts several organized conferences (including a much anticipated keynote by a local legend) and training sessions to teach the inexperienced wizards how to control more powerful magics, as well as exhibitions to educate those who fear magic that it can be used for good.

Ten years ago there was an unfortunate set of incidents at the festival, a chain of events that caused so much chaos during the convention that the organizers were unwilling to host it ever again. But after the insistence of some members of the city council the organizers agreed to host the convention within the city limits once again.

If only there were a group of people that would be willing to volunteer and maintain order during the festival...

149227.name: Caspar and Henry
149227.description:
Subtitle:

A Roleplaying Game About Atonement and Madness

Game introduction:

Caspar and Henry is a roleplaying game for two game masters (GMs) and two or more players. Thus the game requires a minimum of four people. I doubt it would work well with more than seven or eight people total, but if you want to try it, by all means do so and let me know how it goes. I’d be especially interested in hearing if you use it in an Art History class!

One GM is an elemental force (or, if you prefer: angel, or even god) named Caspar. The other GM is of the same level of supernatural ability (but not alignment) and is named Henry.

The players are human pilgrims on a penitential pilgrimage to atone for their sins. “What sins are those?” you may ask.

Ah, we don’t know yet. In fact, that’s what the game is all about...


The complete game is found in the Files section below, completely free to download.

149228.name: Epic War 2
149228.description:
User Summary

The second installment of Epic War features all new artwork, three playable races and dozens of new units. The defense of yours and and the obliteration of the enemy tower remain your primary objectives. To this end, summon and upgrade your units, tower and abilities. Shoot tons of arrows on the enemy forces and defeat the three huge bosses waiting for you!

149231.name: Epic War 3
149231.description:
User Summary

Epic War 3 features superb artwork, an improved map, new races and units. You control an upgradable deck of units and abilities, and need to form a winning strategy. Defend your castle and use your powers to crush the enemy forces and castles.

149237.description:
This is a set of 15 Metallized Gallions of Victory to replace the cardboard ones that come with the game.

They were originally available as an add-on during the 2013 Kickstarter campaign; future availability is unknown at this time.
149237.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Metal Gallons of Glory

149240.description:
The Krayton was a Ferengi D'Kora-class Marauder in service in the mid-24th century. Under the command of DaiMon Tog, the Krayton abducted Betazoid ambassador Lwaxana Troi, her daughter Deanna, and Commander William T. Riker.

They were tracked down by the USS Enterprise-D and Captain Picard was able to secure the release of the prisoners.

This ship is the competitive prize for Month 1 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Dominion War.
149240.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Krayton Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
149241.description:
Assault on Doomrock is a co-operative adventure game set in a humorous fantasy world. Players start the adventure by generating random heroes from two cards. Combinations like sadistic paladin, stinky warrior, frustrated mage or impatient rogue are only few of the possibilities.

The unique party of heroes will venture forth into a randomly assembled world map. While gaining crazy abilities, and searching for gold and ridiculous items, heroes must face three increasingly difficult encounters. These battles play out in a grid-free, highly tactical battle system that uses character positioning, dice and ability cards.

The goal of the game is to defeat the third epic boss encounter. In order to do that, heroes must carefully exploit the map to grow as powerful as possible before they run out of time.

Feature highlights:

Fully cooperative board game, with card driven artificial intelligence.
Variable heroes and scenarios, generated from over 300 cards.
Grid-free, highly tactical battle system, with dice allocation planning phase.
Fully randomized adventure on the world map, with quests, events, shops and rewarding exploration.
6 Heroes with 8 random traits. 74 unique ability cards. 70 item rewards.
9 possible battle encounters, each with their unique artificial intelligence deck, which gives over 30 battle encounter combinations.
149241.name: Assault on Doomrock
boardgamepodcastepisode: Podcast #104 - Juegos o juguetes

149242.name: Hanoi
149242.description: Players start with three stacks of five discs, each stacked by decreasing size 5-4-3-2-1. Each move involves splitting a stack to deploy each piece along a (possibly different) line of the mover's choice, to stop on the closest N+1 disc, if any, else the furthest empty cell. The game ends when a multicoloured stack of height 5 is formed, and is won by the player with the majority of discs in this stack.

149243.description:
The Heat is an expansion for the co-op board-game Police Precinct. It consists of two decks of cards. One deck is called The Gear Deck, and the other is called The Specialist Deck. There are 8 cards in each deck.

The nature of the cards makes the base-game easier (the cards help for the Police to do their job better). The cards are used in conjunction with heightened challenges for the police created by difficult to handle set-up scenarios.

This expansion really adds to the replayability and strategic team-work aspects of Police Precinct.
149243.name: Police Precinct: The Heat

149244.name: Huey Leader
149244.description:
Huey Leader puts you in the cockpits of the Vietnam War’s best Close Air Support aircraft. In Huey Leader, fly search and destroy missions to attack enemy troops, fly missions to deploy US ground troops into hostile Landing Zones and then provide Close Air Support to help the troops complete their mission, and even fly resupply missions to keep US Forward Bases supplied.

Huey Leader is based on our popular Thunderbolt-Apache Leader game system. If you've played TAL, you'll be up and flying missions against the Vietcong in minutes.

The game places you in command of the pilots and aircraft of a squadron of U.S. Close Air Support (CAS) aircraft.

A major part of the game is mission planning. You decide how to arm your aircraft and which pilots are best for the mission. Pilots are rated for skill level. Deciding which pilots to fly each mission is a major consideration. Your pilots will become fatigued with every mission. If you fly a pilot too often, his skills will degrade. Your pilots also gain experience with every mission flown. This makes for some great decision-making. Should you keep flying the top pilots and further fatigue them to get the job done, or fly the new guys to prep them for the tough missions ahead?

Missions are quickly resolved using an area movement system to display tactical combat over the target. Speed and realism take top priority in this game. Terrain cards randomly generate each battlefield. The cards include mountain ranges that block lines of sight from both you and the enemy forces. If you plan it right, you get to fly nap of the earth through the canyons and come screaming over the ridgeline to rain fire down on the enemy before they can react. Beware! During each battle enemy air defenses will pop-up on the map to ruin your day, so watch were you’re flying!

You get to resolve every shot taken at you by enemy AAA, and every air to ground attack you make against the enemy targets. Each enemy tank, APC, Infantry Squad, Machinegun Nest, etc is represented by its own counter on the battlefield.

While performing each mission, you get to decide how your pilots engage the enemy Vehicles, Troops, and AAA Sites. This makes for some tough choices. Do you hit the high value targets first, or take out the enemy AAA assets first?

Your aircraft are usually able to survive more than one attack. These aircraft are rugged and made to soak-up damage. This also factors into your decision-making. How long should you loiter over the target blowing-up enemy targets before heading for home? If your aircraft is too shot-up, it may not be able to fly for days.

Huey Leader features an operation combat sheet that tracks the progress of enemy formations attempting to overrun your sector. You get to select the formation you want to engage each day and assign the air assets you think are best suited to the task.

We’ve included the cards for every pilot to progress in experience from Newbie, to Green, Average, Skilled, Veteran, and Ace!

Key Design Features:
An all-around excellent solitaire game.
Manage your pilots as well as your hardware to be a successful squadron commander.
Intuitive, fast-playing game system.

Huey Leader includes the following aircraft:
UH-1 Iroquois
CH-47 Chinook
AH-1 Cobra
OH-6 Cayuse
A-1 Skyraider
AC-47 Spooky

Component List:
165 Full Color Cards
2 Full Color Counter Sheets (352 counters)
3 Full Color Counter Sheets with Terrain Hexes (18 counters)
22” x 17” Full Color Tactical Sheet
1 Full Color Air Base Sheet
1 Full Color Player Log Sheet

Scheduled Campaign List:
Westmoreland's War 1/1965
Operation Hump 10/1965
Khe Sanh 1/1968
Tet Offensive 1/1968
Easter Offensive 3/1972
And more!

Target Audience:
This game is perfect for both expert level military gamers as well as first time gamers. The core rules are easy to grasp and very intuitive, while still giving players a wide variety of decision-making options and tactical choices.

Each mission requires only in 30 to 60 minutes.

Each campaign consists of 2 to 10 Days in which you’ll fly one or more missions each Day.

149245.description: Promotional card for the game Nations. Available through BGG store and selected events and campaigns. English version only.
149245.name: Nations: Nicola Tesla promo card

149246.description: Promotional card for the game Nations. Available through BGG store and selected events and campaigns. English version only.
149246.name: Nations: Hagia Sophia promo card

149247.name: Nations: Grand Duchy of Finland promo card
149247.description: Promotional card for the game Nations. Included in the first printing of the game only, in English, German, French and Italian versions.

149248.description: Promotional card for the game Nations. Included in Spielbox magazine, issue 5/2013. English and German versions, depending on the language of the magazine.
149248.name: Nations: Kremlin promo card

149249.description: Promotional card for the game Nations. Included in Spielbox magazine, issue 5/2013. English and German versions, depending on the language of the magazine.
149249.name: Nations: Mechanical Turk promo card

149250.name: Colorinto
149250.description:
Colorinto is a deck of abstract paintings that challenges players with different games of visual skill, ranging from solitaire to speed contest or to strategy.

When put together, those paintings form a museum, in which every room has one picture on it. It can be only visited following certain rules that are hidden inside the paintings.

The goal of the game is to discover and create paths that cross the maze, sometimes discovering the longest route in less time than the opponents, other times by creating the museum itself so it follows certain conditions.

A game recommended for people with a liking to challenging games with simple rules, abstract art aesthetics or unconventional mazes.

149251.name: Lewis & Clark Sticker Sheet
149251.description: Essen 2013 Promo consisting of a sticker sheet depicting resources to be stuck on the wooden resource hexagons.

149252.description: Essen 2013 promo consisting of an 8 page booklet to note the teams' scores.
149252.name: SOS Titanic: Score Booklet

149253.name: Might & Magic Heroes: Crag Hack the Barbarian
149253.description: This mini-expansion introduces into M&M Heroes: The Boardgame a new Hero and 2 new Hero Starting Abilities. Crag Hack is a neutral Hero – it does not belong to any faction and may be hired by any player.

149254.name: Clique Mystique
149254.description: Clique Mystique is a tile-laying card game for two players, using the Mystique Deck. The object is to own the most cards at the end of the game. Play starts from a randomly dealt 3x3 array of cards and gradually expands into a 7x7 virtual board. Players form groups of closely related cards (Cliques) or completely unrelated cards (Motley Crews), capturing opposing stacks in the process.

149255.name: The Outcast Heroes: Alternative Missions
149255.description:
An exclusive double-sided promo sheet available at Spiel 2013 in Essen.

Playing The Outcast Heroes, you will become a commander of a Polish underground military unit and fight against Communism. The USSR wants to include Poland in its influence zone, but there are still people who resist and stand up for independence. Will you manage to stop the red plague?

The Outcast Heroes: Alternative Missions is a double-sided promotional item that can replace the "Free the prisoners" special mission card with two new missions, with alternative rules and different difficulty levels. Both sides of the item show real prison buildings from the communist times in Poland.

149256.description:
During Sigismundus Augustus: Dei gratia rex Poloniae, a board game for 3 to 5 players, each player rules one of the 16th-century noble families. The aim is to establish the position of the House in Rzeczpospolita and in the international arena. To gain more prestige than other players and win the game, each House has to fight for the influence in Sejm or for authority among neighbors, while also maintaining a strong and effective army.

Sigismundus Augustus: Dei gratia rex Poloniae - Bona Sforza d'Aragona is a double-sided promo sheet that represents the ambiguous opinions on Queen Bona circulating among historians. One side shows her as generous and helpful, while the other as treacherous and poisonous; each side has an ability that can be used once per round.
149256.name: Sigismundus Augustus: Dei gratia rex Poloniae – Bona Sforza d'Aragona

149257.description:
The wind is from the north today, carrying a foul stench.

I used to think of necromancy as a black fog, thickening and spreading, covering us in oppressive gloom. I see, now, that this was wrong: A fog is made all of the same stuff, but our doom has many distinct facets, each one we penetrate revealing a new evil behind. Some have become terrified of the darkness; others made numb by despair. Many have had their bodies rent, while others are starting to lose their minds. A scout has just sent word of another new variety of monstrosity that has appeared near the village...but also the discovery of a new artifact that may help us fight them.
Fate, it seems, never runs out of ideas. We can only handle each new challenge as best we can as it arrives on shifting winds...

Darkest Night: On Shifting Winds from Jeremy Lennert expands the game with a variety of new content: It adds the Ranger, Scout, Wayfarer, and Wind Dancer as new playable heroes, introduces eight new blights and new treasures to search for, and also includes new Event and Artifact cards.

On Shifting Winds can be used either with or without the first expansion, With an Inner Light.

Note: This game requires that you (or someone in your group of players) own a copy of Darkest Night.

Game Data:

Complexity: 4.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale

Game components:

- One full color 8-page Rules booklet
- Four standing character tokens (minor assembly required)
- Four hero sheets
- 40 Power cards (10 per hero)
- 10 Artifact cards
- 10 Event cards
- 15 map cards
- 22 1" square blight counters
- Eight multi-shaped item counters
149257.name: Darkest Night: On Shifting Winds

149258.name: Ancient Buildings 1
149258.description:
From publisher blurb:

The lone tower - building maps

The lone tower is an rpg supplement for personal or commercial gaming projects. It can be used for adventures or more complex products where detailed building maps are needed. There are many features to make the use of these maps more convenient. Illustrations of the building (lineart and colored), levels with color and letter code, tiled blueprint to know the measures and a signal code. There are also some extra features to make the exploration more fun, like secret areas and an underground level.

149259.name: Mechanical Powers
149259.description:
From publisher blurb:

Awesome Powers is a supplement for the BASH! Ultimate Edition RPG. Inside, you will find new Powers, new Enhancements, new Limitations, and new ideas to incorporate into your BASH! campaigns.

Chiefly, this product is designed to allow you to create characters with themes, making use of pre-designed powers. You can use these powers for inspiration, or you can even create your character by rolling for powers at random. As the Awesome Powers library grows, so will the list of available powers.

Volume 2 of Awesome Powers deals with powers of a Mechanical nature. There are dozens of powers for Bionic, Robotic, and Power Armor Suites here.

You'll also find all new Limitations and Enhancements (like Doubles and Recoil), entirely new Advantages and Disadvantages (like Support Squad and Brain in a Jar), how to create your own Powers, and Random Character Creation!

Each of the powers presented here explains how to replicate the power described as closely as possible using the existing BASH! Ultimate Edition rules. In this second volume of Awesome Powers, we present to your three themes, or Power Suites, each based on a different mechanical trope. Future supplements will include Plant, Animal, Technopathy, Artifact, Psionic, and various other Power Suites.

149260.name: Comic Character Cavalcade #1
149260.description:
From publisher blurb:

Comic Character Cavalcade is a series from Basic Action Games for use with BASH! Ultimate Edition. These characters were submitted by BASH! fans who pre-ordered a full color printing of the characters from Cavalcade #1-5. There are still slots left if you are interested in making your own Cavalcade Character! Simply search for "Cavalcade" on the Basic Action Games website for more details.

In Comic Character Cavalcade #1 you'll meet:

Alley Cat: The fierce feline mutant with a dark past learning the ropes of redemption as a super heroine.
Battery: Biker who absorbs energy... which also makes him get high. Fighting super-villains seemed like a natural way to do what he loves without getting arrested for it.
Benny the Bomb: Mutant with explosive powers who doesn't care who he hurts, he's also one of the baddest mob bosses the city has ever seen.
Frost: Ghastly hunter of the night with demonic powers... but he's one of the good guys!
Iron Mandarin: Power suited hero also trained in mystical arts. The son of a villainous sorcerer and cyber-ninja, he seeks to restore honor to the family.
Leviathon: The future Queen of the Depths, Leviathon is often riding the waves when she isn't beneath them.
Mass Attack: A skinny weakling who wished to be massive... and got more than he bargained for.
Nangwaya: An African emigre with a magical tooth necklace, giving him the speed and power of a lion.
Tempest: The daughter of the devious villain, Dr. Maelstrom, Tempest now juggles her life as a lawyer with that of a super hero trying to redeem her father's misdeeds.
Tiger Shrike: A research scientist whose unappreciated genius yielded bitter fruit, he now uses his sonic inventions to make a name for himself as "Tiger Shrike" the sinister sultan of sound!




Cavalcade #1 Includes:

A comic-styled character sheet for ten characters featuring an excellent illustration.
A collection of 3 Story Seeds for each character.
A collection of "Tussles and Team-Ups" wherein each character encounters each of the other characters. Between the Story Seeds and Tussles and Team-Ups, that is over 70 plots.
Printable fold-up paper miniatures of each character.

149261.description:
Fend off a stone giant invasion, raid magical dungeons, and unlock the mystery of an ancient empire with the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Fortress of the Stone Giants Adventure Deck (Deck #4).

This 110-card expansion to the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords Base Set includes new locations, monsters, villains, loot, and more, as well as 5 new scenarios that constitute the complete Fortress of the Stone Giants adventure. Continue your character’s legend with the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Fortress of the Stone Giants Adventure Deck.
149261.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Adventure Deck 4 - Fortress of the Stone Giants
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit - Episode 29: The Expanded Expansion Special

149262.name: Triumphant! The Super Heroic Role Playing Game
149262.description:
From publisher blurb:

TRIUMPHANT! The Super Heroic Role Playing Game Superheroic role playing action at its best. Triumphant! has straightforward character generation by dice allocation or determined randomly, if you prefer. Most of the powers you'd expect to see in a super heroic rpg - plus, it's simple to add more, if needed. Powers used to both attack and defend - zap down that power blast with your laser-eyes! Rules for hazards and disasters, vehicles, minions and more. A modest sample setting - Sovereign City with adventures ideas to get your own campaign under way in minutes.

149263.name: Dungeon Duelers
boardgamepodcastepisode: AUG The Game of Crowd Funding Cody Walsh Interview 12-04-2013
149263.description:
In Dungeon Duelers, players will take the rolls of Duelers beginning their journey to become Duel Champions, hoping to one day become members of one of the four Guilds of Glory. The game represents a vast journey across the entire world of Thexia. During the game players will capture monsters of their own which they will train. There is no limit to how powerful your monster can become! They will face several encounters like Duelers, Bandits, wild monsters, traps, and other challenges. As they travel between the regions they will discover ancient dungeons filled with rare monsters and treasure. Players will also complete quests that earn them fame which increases their chances of being chosen to be a Guild member. The game can be played competitively or semi-cooperatively if players want to team up against each other to speed the journey along.

The game is divided into basic and advanced versions. The basic version is much faster to play and simply requires removing a few components and not using some of the content such as the monsters unique abilities. The advanced version is played using all components and takes about 2 hours to play. There are also components that allow for custom character creation which allow a player to save their information to continue playing again possibly using expansions.

149264.description:
These 7 cards were available in pre-order of Legacy directly from Portal Games website.

The extra Mansion cards can be used to replace the standard Mansion cards from the game. Besides increasing a player's Prestige, each extra Mansion has an additional unique effect.

Unless explicitly stated otherwise, the Mansion special effect is resolved immediately and one-time only after the Buy a Mansion action is completed.



PL:Tych 7 kart dodawanych było do egzemplarzy Dziedzictwa zamawianych w przedsprzedaży bezpośrednio z Portal Games.

Dodatkowych kart Pałaców można użyć w zastępstwie standardowych kart dostępnych w grze. W odróżnieniu od podstawowych Pałaców – oprócz podnoszenia Prestiżu – każdy z nich posiada dodatkowy, unikatowy efekt.
Jeśli wyraźnie nie zaznaczono inaczej, to efekt działania Pałacu należy rozpatrzeć jednorazowo po jego zakupieniu, natychmiast po zakończeniu akcji Pałac.
149264.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy – Extra Mansion Cards

149265.name: Triumphant! Public Domain Super Heroes #1
149265.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now a blast from the Golden Past can appear in your games as the heroes of yesteryear are statted up for the Triumphant! Super Hero Roleplaying Game from Simon Washbourne. In this exciting issue you get 5 superheroes to drop into your Triumphant! games.

In this issue the following supers appear:

Alias the Dragon - a scientist with a burning desire to stop crime
Ace the Amazing Boy - A Boy with a Bat
Amazona - Winter Wonder Land Woman
Queen Alice - Underground Vixen
Amazing Man - Tibetan Crime Fighter

149266.name: Triumphant! Public Domain Super Heroes #2
149266.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now a blast from the Golden Past can appear in your games as the heroes of yesteryear are statted up for the Triumphant! Super Hero Roleplaying Game from Simon Washbourne. In this exciting issue you get 5 superheroes to drop into your Triumphant! games.

In this issue the following supers appear:

Atlas the Mighty - a mighty man of valor
Ant Queen - a woman that will bug your heroes!
Ardora - a space princess you'll need saving from
Apollo - a god with a really sunny dispostion
American Eagle (Nedor) - this heroes patriotism soars

149267.name: Triumphant! Public Domain Super Heroes #3
149267.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now a blast from the Golden Past can appear in your games as the heroes of yesteryear are statted up for the Triumphant! Super Hero Roleplaying Game from Simon Washbourne. In this exciting issue you get 5 superheroes to drop into your Triumphant! games.

In this issue the following supers appear:

Akina
Airman
American Crusader
Arrow
Atoma

149268.name: Psionics Augmented, Volume I
149268.description:
From publisher blurb:

Augment your psionic characters with this 70+ pages of new content in a full-color, softcover book, expanding on the options from Psionics Unleashed and Psionics Expanded.

Included are:

2 new races - the forgeborn and noral
30 new racial archetypes - 3 for every psionic race
18 new non-racial archetypes - 1 for every psionic class, 1 for all the base classes not covered in Psionics Expanded
40 new feats
A Game Mastery section, giving tips, insights, and instructions to GMs on how to use psionics in their games, including a treatise on changing the nature of psionics to fit your campaign style
2 new psionic powers
1 new prestige class
11 pages of new psionic items
10 legendary psionic items




Psionics Augmented requires Psionics Unleashed.

149269.name: Skies Over Danbury
149269.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Skies Over Danbury is a set of three adventures for Dungeon World. These adventures follow the events of Within the Devil's Reach but can be played separately You and your party are tracking down your mentor's old adventuring party in the hopes that they might be able to help keep the dark god Kryos from rising again. You must brave pirate islands, flying ships, holy wars, undead elves, and courtly intrigue to find Alastor's old friends. What are you and your band of friends going to do? Find out in, The Skies Over Danbury, the second in a series of adventure books that will take players across a wide fantasy world and pit them against pirates, dragons, mechanized undead and a god of pure reason and evil. The full adventure set, Gears of the Worm God, kicks off with a bang and ends in blood.

149270.name: Doll
149270.description:
- From the author's website and Kickstarter page

Doll is a storytelling game for two. One person plays a child whose pet has just died. The other person plays the child's doll, puppet, or other toy. The doll knows everything that goes on in the house, but it does not always tell the truth. During the game the child will try to find out the truth about her parents from her unreliable doll.

149271.name: Advanced Doll
149271.description:
- From the author's website and Kickstarter page

A four-page supplement to Doll that adds rules for additional players, distinct advantages for different kinds of doll or puppet, additional events to drive your story through additional twenty minute sessions, and alternate 'scenarios' by way of different lists of scene questions.

149272.name: Edge of Space: Peace Keepers Gate
149272.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are Peace Keepers, guardians of the corperate way of life. Jump through the gate and teach those native lifeforms who is really in control here.

Featuring rules for modified weapons, huge monsters, and even bigger mobs, Peace Keepers Gate is a great addition to your Edge of Space: Science Fiction Roleplaying Game. This product requires Edge of Space: Science Fiction Roleplaying Game to be used.

149273.description:
Amerigo Queenie 1: Volcanic Island, a mini-expansion for Amerigo, consists of one module that can be used individually or in combination with any other modules for the game. When setting up the game, place the volcanic island tile in the central playing area, then place one gold tile face down on each marked space on this tile. Whenever someone builds over one of these tiles, she reveals the number on the tile and immediately receives that much gold.

Confirmed by Stefan Feld: "The volcano island tile is a tile with 4 islands seperated by a volcano (instead of water).
You can´t build on the volcano space."
149273.name: Amerigo Queenie 1: Volcanic Island

149274.description: Amerigo Queenie 3: Special Production Buildings and Tokens, a mini-expansion for Amerigo, consists of one module that can be used individually or in combination with any other modules for the game. With this expansion in the game, when a player chooses the red Plan action, he can take one of the four production building tiles instead of a neutral landscape tile; when he uses the green Build action to place this building on an island, he takes one of the five special production tokens available and places it on his player sheet. These production tokens are treated like any other during scoring.
149274.name: Amerigo Queenie 3: Special Production Buildings and Tokens

149275.description: Amerigo Queenie 2: Cove Island, Bay Island & New Progress Tokens, a mini-expansion for Amerigo, consists of additional components that can be mixed with those in the base game. The cove island tile has many small island pieces with a large central waterway, while the bay island tile has a massive block of land that will almost certainly create a large island in the playing area. The six progress tokens add new abilities that players can gain during the game, such as the ability to ignore the pirates once or to take a second action at the end of a round.
149275.name: Amerigo Queenie 2: Cove Island, Bay Island & New Progress Tokens

149276.name: Empty Graves
149276.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Following the opening of its necropolis, the city of Wati is overrun by hordes of the unquiet dead. The heroes must once more brave the abandoned streets and dusty tombs of Wati’s necropolis in search of the powerful artifact called the Mask of the Forgotten Pharaoh, as well as the necromancer who is using it to create the undead uprising. But mysterious masked cultists also seek the artifact so they can bring a pharaoh from the ancient past back to life. Can the heroes defeat the evil necromancer and return the deceased to their graves, or will Wati truly become a city of the dead?

This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path continues the Mummy’s Mask Adventure Path and includes:


"Empty Graves,” a Pathfinder adventure for 4th-level characters, by Crystal Frasier.
A double-sized article that peers into the gods and faiths of Ancient Osirion, by Rob McCreary.
A terror-filled night in a family tomb in the Pathfinder’s Journal, by Amber E. Scott.
Four desert-dwelling monsters, by Crystal Frasier, Thurston Hillman, and Will McCardell.

149277.name: Shifting Sands
149277.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Chapter 3: "Shifting Sands"
By Richard Pett

To learn more about the ancient Pharaoh Hakotep I and the secretive cult that wants to revive him, the heroes travel to the city of Tephu to explore the vast archives in its Great Library. This is no small task, as they must contend with those who wish such knowledge to remain forgotten. With the clues they discover, the heroes venture deep into Osirion’s uncharted deserts in search of the tomb of Hakotep’s master pyramid-builder. There they face not only dangerous denizens of the desert, but the cult of the Forgotten Pharaoh—cultists who will stop at nothing to ensure their god-king remains undisturbed.

This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path continues the Mummy’s Mask Adventure Path and includes:


“Shifting Sands,” a Pathfinder RPG adventure for 7th-level characters, by Richard Pett.



A gazetteer of the city of Tephu, the City of the Reed People, by Richard Pett.



A study of the rituals of mummification, by Russ Taylor.



Ancient secrets and deadly kidnappers in the Pathfinder’s Journal, by Amber E. Scott.



Five new monsters, by Benjamin Bruck, Adam Daigle, Thurston Hillman, Michael McCarthy, and Patrick Renie.

149278.name: Secrets of the Sphinx
149278.description:
From the back of the book:

FORGOTTEN NO MORE

Deep in the Osirian desert stands the blank-faced monument known as the Sightless Sphinx. In search of the stolen mummy of Chisisek, the architect of the flying tomb of the Sky Pharaoh Hakotep I, the heroes track the cult of the Forgotten Pharaoh to its secret headquarters inside the sphinx. There they must face monstrous mercenaries and servants of the demon lord Areshkagal before finally confronting the masked cultists and their leader, the Forgotten Pharaoh, who has been possessed by a fragment of Hakotep’s soul.

This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path continues the Mummy’s Mask Adventure Path and includes:


"Secrets of the Sphinx", a Pathfinder adventure for 10th-level characters, by Amber E. Scott.
An exploration of the sinister world of curses, by Russ Taylor.
Two exciting additional encounters in Osirion’s wastes, by Greg A. Vaughan.
Reptilian rage and unexpected rescue in the Pathfinder’s Journal, by Amber E. Scott.
Five newmonsters to challenge player characters, by Michael Kortes, David Schwartz, and Larry Wilhelm.

149279.name: The Slave Trenches of Hakotep
149279.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The nation of Osirion was born at the dawn of the Age of Destiny, and over the millennia, a succession of powerful pharaohs and god-kings have guided its people through history. Royal pyramids and monuments to pharaonic rule are scattered throughout the deserts of Osirion, many buried beneath the shifting sands for centuries, hidden from modern memory.

Each monthly full-color softcover Pathfinder Adventure Path volume contains an in-depth adventure scenario, stats for several new monsters, and support articles meant to give Game Masters additional material to expand their campaign. Pathfinder Adventure Path volumes use the Open Game License and work with both the Pathfinder RPG and the world’s oldest fantasy RPG.

149280.name: Pyramid of the Sky Pharaoh
149280.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The nation of Osirion was born at the dawn of the Age of Destiny, and over the millennia, a succession of powerful pharaohs and god-kings have guided its people through history. Royal pyramids and monuments to pharaonic rule are scattered throughout the deserts of Osirion, many buried beneath the shifting sands for centuries, hidden from modern memory.

Each monthly full-color softcover Pathfinder Adventure Path volume contains an in-depth adventure scenario, stats for several new monsters, and support articles meant to give Game Masters additional material to expand their campaign. Pathfinder Adventure Path volumes use the Open Game License and work with both the Pathfinder RPG and the world’s oldest fantasy RPG.

149281.name: Ironcrux
149281.description:
Ironcrux is an abstract strategy game in which 2-4 players take turns moving their colored piece, which starts from one corner, across a square grid of pieces. Each move shrinks the grid by one piece, making maneuvering increasingly more difficult. In certain situations, a few removed pieces can be returned to the grid to open up new movement options.

When a player cannot make a legal move, he is eliminated. The last player standing wins.

149282.name: Mummy's Mask Pawn Collection
149282.description:
publisher blurb

Key monsters and NPCs from the Mummy’s Mask Adventure Path come alive on your tabletop with this collection of more than 100 creature pawns for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any tabletop fantasy RPG! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn presents a beautiful full-color image of a monster or NPC from the Mummy’s Mask campaign, including masked cultists, mummies, sphinxes, and unique NPCs that are also suitable to represent player characters. Each cardstock pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from the Pathfinder Pawns Bestiary Box, making them easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. With tons of distinct creature images, the Mummy’s Mask Pawn Collection brings the friends and foes of the Pathfinder world alive like never before!

· The Half-Dead City · Empty Graves · Shifting Sands
· Secrets of the Sphinx · The Slave Trenches of Hakotep · Pyramid of the Sky Pharaoh

149283.name: Ironburst
149283.description:
Ironburst is a tactical combat board game using detailed metal miniatures and modular hex-based maps. It plays quick and has simple rules with good tactical scalability. Set-up is fast and so are battles.

The goal is to complete objectives: gathering resources, building, or eliminating specific enemy troops, etc. Players gather resources located on the board to build and repair units and to buy special Event Cards.

The miniature line and the game were developed together, so the miniatures are designed to fit the game mechanisms and vice versa. More specifically, each miniature has multiple moving parts that can be removed (if they are destroyed) and rotated (to aim, to indicate that a weapon has already fired, etc.). Thus, these modular miniatures allow players to do bookkeeping and track game events directly on the battlefield instead of using paper. The moving parts are magnetic and can be swapped in and out to allow players to customize their forces.

To allow the moving parts to take the stress and friction of repeated movement, Ironburst miniatures are cast in a special zinc alloy called ZAMAK, which is not as soft as tin (and much lighter), nor as fragile as resin, while keeping a good amount of detail.

149284.name: Mummy's Mask
149284.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Give life to your NPCs with Mummy's Mask Face Cards! More than 50 key characters fill this gorgeously illustrated deck designed for use with the Mummy's Mask Adventure Path, but suitable for use in any fantasy roleplaying game! Each card includes the character’s name, his or her role in the Mummy's Mask Adventure Path, space to record key details, and artwork by Paizo’s finest illustrators. These Face Cards bring the most prominent cast members of this Adventure Path to your tabletop and let your players look into the faces of the enemy!

149285.name: Wrath of the Righteous
149285.description:
From the back of the box:

Bring your NPCs to life with the Wrath of the Righteous Face Cards! More than 50 key characters fill this gorgeously illustrated deck designed for use with the Wrath of the Righteous Adventure Path, but suitable for any fantasy game! Each card includes the character's name and role, space to record key details, and artwork by Paizo's finest illustrators. These Face Cards bring the most prominent cast members of this epic Adventure Path to your tabletop and let your players look into the faces of the enemy!

149286.description:
Hanau 1813 focus on the last events of 1813 Campaign in Germany. It includes a two day battle between French and their former Bavarian Allies: Napoleon against Wrede on October 30th, Marmont against Wrede on October 31st.

Hanau 1813 is the 36th battles of the Jours de Gloire series.

Napoleon, MacDonald and Marmont are at the head of the French Grande Armée. Wrede commands the Austro-Bavarian army.

The French player has to open his way back to France by clearing the Coalised army which blocks the main road to Frankfurt. The Imperial Guard fights to get out of the trap.

The game includes an A2 map, a color player aid and 216 counters and markers.
Bilingual Rules and Charts (English/French).
149286.name: Hanau 1813

149287.name: Hellmouth High
149287.description:
From the Text

A Strange Adolescence

Sure, here in this sleepy coastal suburb, we have high-quality public education, easy beach access, 330 days of sunshine a year, and seemingly no good right to complain.

But the living here isn’t exactly easy: the jerk jocks and alpha bitches make life unbearable for anyone who doesn’t fit their narrow definition of cool. Then there’s the truly weird crap: the disappearances, the exsanguinations, the demon possessions, the ancient curses, and all the damn vampires.
So you keep your head down, mind your own business, and hope the hyenas don’t smell your fear. You let your friends keep you sane, that motley assortment of freaks and geeks bound together by mutual awkwardness.

And maybe, just maybe, if you don’t fuck up too bad, you might score a little respect, score that winning touchdown, score with the homecoming queen. Hell, you might even make it out of here alive.

MOVIE NIGHT

Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Carrie, The Faculty, Ginger Snaps, Lost Boys

149288.name: Star Frontiers: Alpha Dawn (Digitally Remastered)
149288.description:
From Introduction:

Star Frontiers was my first game purchase. I shelled out ten bucks and had no idea exactly what I had bought. I knew it was a game, I knew it looked cool, but I had never played a role-playing game before and wasn’t entirely certain what to expect.

I opened the box when I got home and found two plastic odd- shaped dice, a white crayon (to fill in the engraved numbers on the plastic dice then wipe off the excess), a couple of books (one called “Basic” and one called “Expanded” rules), and a bunch of tactical maps and punch-out chits.

My first game was a lot of fun, though I did just about everything wrong that I think is possible. The character’s stats were all inflated, I kept increasing IM with each roll, adding over and over... You name it I did it wrong. But it was an amazing experience.

After a few years, I had a lot of experience with role-playing. Friends got me into playing D&D and some others, and I learned the value of good story-telling.

During all this time, I kept playing Star Frontiers. My human military specialist turned spy became very tough, able to handle just about any situation. He had enemies and friends all over the frontier, had an island on a remote world with a private military base and a small army to defend it. I played other characters, but Gavin Rove was always my favorite.

The most amazing thing about all this... I never purchased another supplement. I played and played, never running out of ideas, imagination, adventures, enemies, and fun. One box is all I needed. Games just don’t sell that way anymore. Any company that did that would be shooting itself in the foot financially.

So that is why I have assembled all these rules here. You won’t find too much modification to the original, I tried to keep it all true. Anything I added is shown as optional, and derived from some published TSR source or another (Dragon Magazine, adventure modules, etc.) I didn’t add much in the way of house rules in order to remain true to the original game. All in all, I’m hoping someone else gets their hands on this book and has years of fun and adventure, just like I did.

149289.name: Knight Hawks (Digitally Remastered)
149289.description:
From Introduction:

What good is science fiction without starships? The original Star Frontiers treated space travel as a means to an end, not a source of adventure itself. In the Alpha Dawn game, your characters booked passage on starliners and mining vessels, were dropped off and had an appointment to rendezvous at a later time. Your character may have known how to fix a skimmer, drive a ground cycle, or navigate around on a planet’s surface, but when it came to space, you needed help.

But now your character has been around, built his reputation and skills. You have a pile of credits obtained through various (sometimes nefarious!) means. You’re tired of waiting two weeks at layovers, looking for passage on the next ship that leaves port.

You want your own starship.

That’s what the Knight Hawks game is about. It’s actually two games in one: First, it’s a strategic board game complete with cardboard counters (you’ll have to download these separately) and a game board (well – you’ll have to supply the hex map too...). Second, it’s a campaign expansion that brings your advanced STAR FRONTIERS characters new options, equipment, skills to select, and let’s not forget starships.

Those alien planets just got closer!

About the counters: you can download them from the same place you got this book. Print them to Avery project paper (you know, that full-page sticky paper) and peel & stick it on project board (not poster board, but that thicker stuff) and get out a ruler and an exacto knife. You’ll have playing pieces in no time.

About the game board: You can make your own by printing out the hex map you’ll find towards the end of this book. Print to project paper, peel & stick on something permanent. Sure, it’s white with black lines while space is mostly black... but use your imagination, man!

149290.name: Volturnus, Planet of Mystery (Digitally Remastered)
149290.description:
From back cover:

The adventure is explosive...

Volturnus: a barren, hostile world. When a pirate attack stranded your party of adventurers here, your luck and skill, and the help of the Ul-Mor, enabled you to survive.

The Kurabanda, a mysterious tree dwelling race, are your only hope of finding the lost explorers you seek. On this planet of mystery and
danger, survival itself is doubtful. Are you equal to the challenge that lies ahead?

VOLTURNUS, PLANET OF MYSTERY is the second in the Volturnus series of
modules for the STAR FRONTIERS game. It can be played as a separate
adventure or as a continuation of CRASH ON VOLTURNUS, included in
the [STAR FRONTIERS book]. VOLTURNUS, PLANET OF MYSTERY contains maps and referee’s notes, as well as full information on several creatures and intelligent races inhabiting the planet. The Volturnus adventure will be continued in [SF2: STARSPAWN OF VOLTURNUS].

149291.name: Starspawn of Volturnus (Digitally Remastered)
149291.description:
From Introduction:

Two weeks to save a world...

Since you crash-landed here, Volturnus has been a planet of constant surprise and peril. You defeated the Star Devil's pirates and made contact with for intelligent races native to the planet. Your adventures with them made clear that these aliens would be valuable members of the UPF -- if they manage to survive.

The vicious Sathar are on their way to Volturnus with a fleet powerful enough to destroy all life on the planet. the Survival of the is in your hands. You must organize the defenses of Volturnus. You must unite the races of Vulturnus and lead them in a battle against the Sathar. The outcome: victory, or death for an entire world!

Starspawn Of Volturnus is the conclusion of the Volturnus series of modules for the Star Frontiers game. It can be also played as a separate adventure. Starspawn Of Volturnus contains maps and referee's notes, including information on new creatures and intelligent races.The module also contains "The Great Game of the Ul-Mor," an encounter that came be used as a re-playable game.

149292.name: The Classroom
149292.description:
User Summary

You are Alex and you do not want to study, so you simply cheat at tests. Testing period is here and you have 10 tests to cheat... ehm ... pass. You need to avoid the teacher who's ready to fail you at the slightest provocation and do all you can to cheat from the class geek. Use your speed and stealth because moving around the class can be tricky! Remember: Avoid the teacher's line of sight at all costs!

149293.name: Sundown on Starmist (Digitally Remastered)
149293.description:
From back cover:

Starmist! A new planet, discovered by a Vrusk merchant ship. A planet whose surface is a frozen waste crossed by giant canyons, kilometers deep. In those canyons are air, water, life, and above all, mystery.

After emergency landing on Starmist, Maximillian Malligigg, Second Officer of the VSS Centispeed, stumbled on a puzzling clue. While his fellow crewmen repaired the drive on their ship, Max made tentative contacts with the humanoids called Heliopes, who live on Starmist.

The Heliopes are members of a primitive, nomadic culture. There is a single village among these nomadic tribes: a village whose people display excellent workmanship. In the village’s center is a massive pyramid and an entire building complex set on platforms above the river.

What did Max find that made him eager to hire you, an intrepid band of adventurers, to join him in returning to Starmist? What secret gave Max visions of wealth and brought you all to this golden rift and the promise of danger!

149294.name: Mission to Alcazzar (Digitally Remastered)
149294.description:
From back cover:

You press against the steel hatchway as the explorer bounds up the river bank, out of the water. Over the roar of the engines comes the unmistakable whine of a high-performance groundcar. Quickly, you scan the horizon. At first the plain appears empty. Then you see them.

“Bandits at 11 o’clock. Three of them!” you shout into your chronocom. Instantly, the driver slams the heavy explorer into reverse, backing down the bank for cover. The rear doors burst open as Rocton dashes out to set up a heavy laser. Harradd, the Yazirian, follows right behind carrying five power beltpacks. Already someone is handing extra ammo up to you.

At 80 kph, those ground cars are closing fast. Targeting the lead car, you squeeze the trigger and a rocket flashes out of the tube. At the same instant a shell streaks past you, exploding in the river and spraying steam into the air.

You came to Alcazzar on a tough mission – it just got a lot tougher.

149295.name: The Apprentice: Los Angeles
149295.description:
User Summary

You start out as an apprentice in a sushi restaurant. You are trying to get the top spot in the Trump organization. Earn as much money as you can by serving your customers as fast and efficiently as possible. Combine strategy with speed and remember: Do not get fired!

149296.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Earth in the early 20th century: The planet has faced many invasions in the past, but never has mankind faced an assault like this, as multiple Dalek armies descend from the skies, seeking to destroy one another and conquer the world.

Many years ago, an ancient artifact was hidden somewhere on the planet, an artifact that will enable the Daleks to reign supreme across the universe, defeating any who stand in their way. Such an object is so valuable that even the Daleks cannot agree how best to wield it, and have split into renegade armies, each as cunning and determined as the next.

In Risk: The Dalek Invasion of Earth, you'll play as one of five different armies, either classic (black, bronze or silver) or New Dalek Paradigm (red or yellow) as you invade Earth seeking the ancient weapon. Only once all opposition has been wiped out can you begin the search. Will you be the last Dalek army left? Watch out for the TARDIS sweeping round the board to defend Earth!

As you fight for supremacy, the Doctor will do his best to stop you, bringing peace to a different territory each turn, and if your army is not victorious by his eleventh regeneration, then the battle is over and all Daleks must retreat as the Oncoming Storm saves the Earth.

With special power cards to boost your forces or destroy your opponents' plans, and special missions to defeat other invading forces, this game of Risk is an epic battle for control of the Earth...and the universe.
149296.name: Risk: The Dalek Invasion of Earth
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 25 - Tabletop Gaming Magazine

149297.name: Bugs in the System (Digitally Remastered)
149297.description:
From back cover:

“Venturi is a gas giant – a huge ball of gas that tried to be a star, but never quite made it. Now it just moans and grumbles and throws out magnetic storms once in a while. The atmosphere would suffocate you except that you’d probably freeze first, or be torn apart by the thousand kilometer an hour winds. You can’t even land there because it hasn’t got a surface, not unless you
count an ocean of liquid hydrogen.

“But, we didn’t let that stop us, not while there were all kinds of valuable chemicals swirling around in that gas-ball. That’s where the Jetson extraction platform comes in. It bobs around like a cork in the upper atmosphere, sucking in gas and distilling out the good stuff. Trouble is, there’s something very wrong down there. I don’t know what it is, but it’s already cost eight good crewmen.

“Are you really sure you want this job?”

Bugs in the System is a fast-moving adventure for use with the STAR FRONTIERS Alpha Dawn game and can only be played with those rules.

149298.name: World Domination
149298.description:
User Summary

You are a world leader pitting yourself against four enemy leaders. Diplomacy, religion and propaganda are all at your disposal. If all else fails, there is also war in many forms such as planes, submarines, rockets, satellites, bio-weapons and, of course, nukes. Can you exterminate your enemies and control the world?

149299.name: World Domination 2
149299.description:
User Summary

In the second installment of this turn-based strategy war game you play as a world leader and have even more ways of achieving world domination. In addition to diplomacy, spies and propaganda you can also invest in infrastructure and, of course go to an all out war using your aircraft carriers, submarines, rockets, satellites and nukes. Also, you have two actions every turn but so do your enemies so plan your strategy well and forge your path to victory.

149300.name: ConSTARlations
149300.description:
In ConSTARlations, players take turns using cards to place, move, replace and remove cards in order to make specific patterns on the board (as dictated by their secret pattern card). When a player's pattern appears on the board — no matter whose stars are responsible — they score the card and pick another.

Pattern cards are worth 1, 2 or 3 points depending on whether the pattern consists of 4, 5 or 6 stars. Players can score their pattern card during their own turn, but also during everyone else's! So they must keep their eyes on the board at all times.

If either of the two Black hole cards are played, all stars on the board are removed and returned to their players.

When one of the piles of pattern cards runs out, everyone gets one last turn before players count up their scored cards to see who has won.

149301.name: Simon Dice
149301.description:
Simon says "roll the dice!"

One player takes the role of the master, rolls the two dice, and reads aloud the results. The other players try to obey those instructions. If anyone can't obey the instruction, doesn't obey it, or falls over while trying then they are eliminated. The last person standing becomes the master for the next game.

The two dice are a "question" die and an "action" die. The question die stipulates a condition, and the action tells you what to do if you meet that condition. So, you might roll the two dice and read out "If you are a boy, stand on one foot" or "If your first name contains an A or an I, hold your left arm out straight" or "if you are smiling, stare at either your feet or the ceiling". You have to keep obeying all prior instructions as you execute new instructions.

Some actions give players a choice, such as "put your right hand on your head or on your stomach". If such an instruction comes up again later, the players have to pick the option they aren't already doing, and do it instead.

All you need are 2 dice to play. You can either create custom dice, or use two differently colored dice and look up the results on a simple table.

149305.name: Nation: A Mighty Spark
149305.description:
"The spread of civilization may be likened to a fire; First, a feeble spark, next a flickering flame, then a mighty blaze, ever increasing in speed and power." - Nikola Tesla

Components:
63 Civilian Cards
12 Starter Civilian Cards
20 Worker Tokens
18 Map Cards
4 Starter Map Cards
20 Player Populace Tokens
5 Neutral Populace Tokens
8 Six Sided Dice
1 Rulebook

Nation: A Mighty Spark is a worker placement strategy card game that takes place on a planet where bugs have evolved into the dominant species.

Players place worker tokens onto a modular map, made of cards, that begin hidden but are revealed as they explore. For each worker placed one of five actions is chosen: The Battle action allows players to modify populaces and civilian cards on the table. The Build action allows placement of populaces onto map cards. The Develop action allows placement of civilian cards from your hands on to the table: providing food for more workers, building materials for populaces and military might. The Draw actions allow players to draw more cards into their hand. The Explore action allows for the revealing of face down map cards.

Players continue taking turns until the civilian draw deck depletes. Victory points are counted based upon the number of civilians in play, populace control and military might.

boardgamepublisher: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba
149306.description:
One card expansion for Santiago de Cuba.
Promo item at the Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2013.
149306.name: Santiago de Cuba: La revolución

boardgamepublisher: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba
149307.description:
One card expansion for Santiago de Cuba.
Promo item at the Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2013.
149307.name: Santiago de Cuba: La manifestación

boardgamepublisher: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba
149308.description:
12 tiles expansion for Santiago de Cuba.
Promo item at the Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2013.
149308.name: Santiago de Cuba: El taxi

boardgamepublisher: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba
149309.description:
8 tiles expansion for Santiago de Cuba.
Promo item at the Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2013.
149309.name: Santiago de Cuba: La siesta

149310.name: Hanabi: ¡Gana o explota!
boardgamepublisher: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba
149310.description:
Hanabi (Cordobesian) variant rules, printed as a mini-expansion card for the Spanish edition of Hanabi (Cocktail Games - Asmodée Ibérica).
Free promo item at the Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2013.

149311.description:
A laminated map for Australia Rails.

This map will not fit into the game box. While it can be used with Mayfair's usual crayons, use with wet-erase markers is common.
149311.name: Australian Rails: Laminated Flat Map

149312.description:
A laminated map for British Rails.

This map will not fit into the game box. While it can be used with Mayfair's usual crayons, use with wet-erase markers is common.

This map will not fit into the game box. While it can be used with Mayfair's usual crayons, use with wet-erase markers is common.

A laminated map for Empire Builder.

This map will not fit into the game box. While it can be used with Mayfair's usual crayons, use with wet-erase markers is common.
149314.name: Empire Builder: Laminated Flat Map

149315.description:
A laminated map for EuroRails.

This map will not fit into the game box. While it can be used with Mayfair's usual crayons, use with wet-erase markers is common.

149319.description:

This map will not fit into the game box. While it can be used with Mayfair's usual crayons, use with wet-erase markers is common.

149320.description:
A laminated map for Russian Rails.

This map will not fit into the game box. While it can be used with Mayfair's usual crayons, use with wet-erase markers is common.
149320.name: Russian Rails: Laminated Flat Map

149321.name: Mezmo
149321.description: Mezmo is a collaborative game for 3 to 11 players, ages 5 and up. In the game players take turns adding a single tile to a slowly growing game board where the other players judge whether or not the played tile fits the "Theme" of the pieces it connects to. The game focuses on the personal judgement of each of the judges, as was as the current player's ability to convince others of their artistic vision. Failure to appease the judges forces the player to take back their piece, as well as receive another random tile from the bag. The game ends when one of the players has no more pieces to play. It's a laid back, casual game that inspires alot of conversation and thought, and is best played with a creative crowd.

149322.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Cthulhu!!!: Hastur La Vista, Baby! thrusts you into a desperate fight against elder forces from beyond space and time. You place the stalwart private detectives and quick-thinking girl Fridays who've stumbled onto the Cult's plans, and it's your job to find and sanctify enough ritual sites to prevent the avatar's arrival. For good or ill, you're already a bit unstable from years of mythos-busting and not above using the Cults' relics yourself. You can resist the objects' siren call long enough to save the world...can't you?
Designed for 2-6 players, Cthulhu!!!: Hastur La Vista, Baby! features an ever-changing map of downtown Kingsport, a 1920s Lovecraft Country city besieged by deranged cultists, frightening creatures from beyond the stars, and an endless supply of mythos mayhem. Players take turns placing map tiles, fighting Hastur's minions, collecting relics of power and striving to save the world from imminent destruction. Every game is different, and the strategy evolves with every new tile that hits the table.
149322.name: Cthulhu!!!: Hastur La Vista, Baby!

149323.name: Yahtzee Steal the Deal
149323.description:
Yahtzee Steal the Deal features a variation of the standard Yahtzee theme as instead of choosing what to roll for, each player has a card drawn from the library with a specific combination.
