Deep Space 9, in the form of an oversized cardboard token with associated cards, is the participation prize for Month 1 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Dominion War. The Grand Prize of the Dominion War tournament will be a pre-painted plastic miniature of Deep Space 9.
149422.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Deep Space 9 Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

149423.name: Who Kidnapped Father Christmas?
149423.description: A fun matching pairs based board game for 2-6 players aged 6 & up...As you travel around the board you have to match pairs of naughty animals to get points..The person with the most points at the end is the person who kidnapped Father Christmas & gets all the toys ! (ie wins)..But watch out as other players can steal your cards which means you have less points than you thought.

149424.name: Horn
videogamehonor: 2013 D.I.C.E. Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
149424.description:
In the action-adventure Horn, immerse yourself in an intricate world filled with entertaining characters, thought provoking puzzles, exciting combat, and extraordinary situations, all controllable by touch gestures.

Based loosely on the Old English tales of King Horn, you play as a young blacksmith's apprentice named Horn who wakes up to finds your village and lands over run by large fantastic, and sometimes humorous, monsters. It is revealed these creatures are actually the people and animals from your village transformed by a curse, and you alone have the power to free them. On your incredible adventure you carry the loud-mouthed head of one such fantastic creature with you - a somewhat uncooperative and ill-tempered but grudgingly helpful sidekick. Along with this new companion you must use your sword, crossbow, trusty musical horn, and wits to explore the lands, defeat the enemies, and solve puzzles in your quest to undo the curse that engulfs your homeland.

Source: IGN.

149425.description:
Tattletale is a fast-paced microgame about the shifting allegiances of elementary school. Each player secretly represents a different faction and plots or opposes plots to get the most playground glory before the teacher has enough and shuts everything down.

During the game, successful plotting will increase the amount of Homework or Horseplay in the school. In addition to earning points for plotting or stopping a plot, each player's secret role gives them bonus points at the end of the game. They might be any of five roles, including the Teacher's Pet, who earn points for Homework, the Jock, who scores for Horseplay, or someone a little unusual like the BFF, who scores with another player.

Twice a game, the teacher comes in and players literally point fingers at each other to cast blame and reduce glory. The basic turn is structured as an iterative Prisoner's Dilemma with the extra twist that a third player opposes you and can cancel both actions if they guess cleverly.
149425.name: Tattletale

149426.name: Esoterica from Thedas Volume 1: Vault
149426.description:
From Introduction:

The following are additions and amendments to the Dragon Age RPG by Green Ronin. These will help fill out the equipment available to players as well as provide alternate rules. The materials used are those from the computer game and like that game should probably be used in concert for all types of equipment as the PCs increase in level. The Fatigue rules give more realistic consequences to play and open up a new area for spells and abilities to affect. Hopefully this will be the first amongst many additions to the game.

NOTE: None of these are set in stone. If you want a Veridium +3 Damage sword then you should go for it. These are just the material levels found in the computer game and are used to make it simple.

149427.name: Esoterica from Thedas Volume 2: Bestiary
149427.description:
From Introduction:

The following are additions and amendments to the Dragon Age RPG by Green Ronin. These will help fill out the opponents and adversaries for players as well as provide template rules for creature creation. This is the second of our fan-made additions to the game and works alongside Volume 1.

This endeavour was mainly to collect together various creatures encountered in the computer game for use in our own adventures, using a consistent creature design system (because some of us are a little pedantic). It seemed a waste not share it once it had been put together. Please make use of this however you see fit, even if it’s just for kindling.

149428.name: Esoterica from Thedas Volume 3: Apothecaria
149428.description:
From Introduction:

Thedas is full of useful crafting ingredients for those with the appropriate skills. This volume contains rules for Herbalism, Recipes for making Thedan preparations and additional background.

Apothecaria is a collation of the lore published about the resources of Thedas, original material to fill some of the gaps adding further dimension and rules to expand playing the RPG.

149429.name: The Oleander Maw
149429.description:
From Introduction:

A Dragon Age RPG Adventure for Characters Level 1-2

The Oleander Maw is a small wooden box, about a foot long and half as wide, ornately carved with the design of a twisting vine featuring oleander flowers. When opened, it is empty, though it smells strongly of oleander as well.

The box has served as the prison for a Desire Demon for unknown time. Udrik, once a rogue maleficar, has been the owner of the box for years. The Desire Demon within tried to possess Udrik at one point, promising him delights of the flesh unimaginable, but Udrik was able to withstand the temptation and trap the demon within the box.

His son, Lord Casden, also possessing a small amount of magical talent, was not so successful. Having seen that his son was madly in love with Fadella, the daughter of the Mayor of Terin, and his inability for years to even show the least expression of that love to the (in his opinion, spoiled) girl, Udrik made a deal with the Desire Demon in the Oleander Maw to give his son the power to achieve his heart’s desire.

After all, Udrik figured, Casden was mediocre enough of a mage that a demon from the Fade would eventually possess him. So, better the demon you know…

149430.name: At Basilisk Fort
149430.description:
From Introduction:

"At Basilisk Fort" is a Dragon Age adventure for 4 to 8 heroes of levels 1 to 2 (about six total levels). The adventure takes place in a small rural fort just outside the Korcari Wilds, and is set sometime before The Battle of Ostagar that opens the Dragon Age: Origins videogame.

149431.name: Bound In Stone
149431.description:
From Introduction:

Bound In Stone is intended for a group of four to six starting Dragon Age characters with a decent mix of abilities to handle the various scenes – combat, exploration and roleplaying – in this adventure. It can work for larger or smaller groups, or different balances of abilities, with some modification.

A number of alternatives exist to making the characters work for the merchant caravan, which is the easiest way to get the characters involved. The characters could come across the caravan on the road and offered a reward for the recovery of the jewel. One of the characters could already possess the jewel and the bandits could steal it from the characters themselves. Finally, the characters could be hired by Koren to help recover his daughter.

149432.name: Worlds of Legend: Son of the Empire
149432.description:
From the back of the box:

Take control of the Assassins, Berserker, Troubadour and Runemaster as they enter the mysterious Empire Of The Moon. Your quest - vengeance for the murder of the Assassin's father, the Emperor of Imperia. Track down the Sorcerer Ti-Mann Mochun, once the Emperor's aide, now your deadly enemy. But watch your backs - the lands of the East are filled with Assassins and Warriors just waiting to fulfil their villainous ambitions! Strangers will be well noticed in these parts...

149433.description:
Firefly: The Game - Big Damn Heroes consists of five cards that feature some of the main characters of the Firefly television series created by Joss Whedon. The promo includes:


Malcolm - a You Can't Take the Sky from Me card
Zoe - Silverhold Munitions card
Wash - Space Bazaar card
Kaylee - Regina card
Jayne - Silverhold Munitions card


Firefly: The Game - Big Damn Heroes was released by ACD Distribution in 2013 as a preorder bonus for Firefly: The Game, then distributed by normal retail outlets in 2014.

Later, the two promo cards "Wash's Lucky Dinosaurs", and "Mal's Pretty Floral Bonnet" were added in to this card set, and it was released as the "Firefly Card Pack" by Gale Force Nine.
149433.name: Firefly: The Game – Big Damn Heroes Promo Cards
boardgamepodcastepisode: MN 0012 Firefly the Game - The Promos and Expansions

149434.name: Campaign To Victory: 1914 In The West
149434.description:
Multi-map conflict simulation covering the German initial attack on Liege and their drive into Belgium and France in WW I until the end of November 1914.

Intermediate complexity yet very playable with unique no-dice system.

Divisional-Brigade level with step-reduction. Limited intelligence and FOW, unit cohesion effects, approx. 5 miles per hex, 2 day turns, variable weather, alternative orders of battles, Special multi-player rules.

Cards for random events; but do not drive the game.

Campaign game with small and medium scenarios.

149435.description:
“Obi-Wan was wise to hide her from me. Now his failure is complete. If you will not turn to the dark side… then perhaps she will…”
-Darth Vader, Star Wars: Return of the Jedi

Lure of the Dark Side is the second Force Pack in the "Echoes of the Force" cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game! Echoes of the Force leads you on an epic exploration of the power of the Force, crossing both the light and the dark sides. Are you disciplined enough to survive the temptations of the dark side? In Lure of the Dark Side, you will uncover both the raw power of the dark side, and the methods the light side can use to resist the seduction of power.

In the second Force Pack of the cycle, you must choose for yourself whether the power offered by the dark side is worth the cost. The ten objective sets (two copies of five different sets) introduced in Lure of the Dark Side are vital in leading you to victory, whether you seek to rise above the enticements of the dark side, or to draw others to the power offered by hate.
149435.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Lure of the Dark Side
boardgamefamily: Star Wars: The Card Game LCG

149437.name: Enigmata (2009)
149437.description:
User Summary

Select your spaceship and experience twenty levels of intense space battle in this epic science fiction game. You may opt to change your ship to a different one and improve it by gathering various powerful upgrades made available when destroying enemies.

149438.name: Word 'em
149438.description:
Word'em is a card game of betting, bluffing, and spelling-showdowns for ages 10 and up.

Word'em melds the “make-your-own luck” aspect of poker and the cerebral challenge of word games.

Every card features a letter and a point value. Your goal in each game is to form the highest-scoring word with the cards available to you, and win the hand.

Word'em cards can be used to play nearly every kind of poker variant with little modification.

149439.name: The Immortal Saga
149439.description:
The Immortal Saga is a collectible competitive card game set in the distant past on ancient Earth. The gods have discovered an unbound power that they receive through human worship, and they thirst for it more than anything else in the universe. We were once used to collect raw materials for the divine sky-chariots to haul away into the heavens, we were nothing more than creatures created by the gods for slave labor… until the divining occurred.

We rebelled against the creators. Fed up with our defiance and costly ignorance, the golden ones ascended into the heavens, much to our surprise. Then, slowly at first but with increasing frequency, our children were born with gifts. We learned that the gods wanted to apologize and through freeing us from their whips and even granting our children the power of the ascended, the beings we once dreaded, were loved as fathers and mothers. We came to accept them as divine beings, for does not a father or mother disciple their children before they are allowed to make decisions that affect their lives? The gods are benevolent and we even have come to depend upon their charity.

All they ask is for our worship and the rains shall fall, the crops shall grow and we shall be at peace… or so we thought. Without worship, the gods cannot function and if one loves their god and their way of life, they will fight for it. So, our leaders, mortals and Immortals alike, have created vast armies to spread the word of our benefactors, the supreme beings that rule over us, like omniscient parents.

The characters are played by Immortals that have been gifted by their god’s, powers of immense potential and limitless possibility. For their gifts, the gods require the Immortal peoples to pontificate the benevolence of the heavenly-ones through words, actions and deeds. Some Immortals find that politics of leadership and the courts are their strong-suit but more often than not, they take to the fields of battle to vanquish the antithesis of their deities. Killing mortals and Immortals, the demi-gods of war shall know no bounds and shall be bound only by their master’s will.

Players create characters through an easy but in-depth creation process. Each character has a school where he learned to use his powers, skills that he picked up to help him during his adventures, techniques which are the moves he uses to engage his foes, equipment to deal damage and blunt attacks, and of course his deck of power. Characters move upon a semi-randomized board as they try to knock their opponents out cold.

149440.name: Enigmata: Stellar War
149440.description:
User Summary

In this final installment of Enigmata, you control a space base. You purchase and strategically position an array of ships so as to defend your base from an ever increasing number of incoming enemy vessels. Your ships increase in rank as they kill enemies and can also be upgraded using coins you gather from the battlefield. There is a much stronger boss ship to defeat at the end of every stage.

The game also features some shared content in which you get to fight against space bases created by other players.

149441.name: DreadBall: Shan-meeg Starhawks
149441.description:
The Starhawks are Asterians, the mysterious humanoid aliens that have the suspicion of many within the Corporate worlds.

The team rules stat them as fast movers on the pitch while simultaneously making them fragile; their armor checks are harder for them to make if they are possibly injured. They also have special rules that allow them to attempt to trick the referees into punishing the other team by faking fouls.

The base team includes:
3 Jacks
1 Guard
4 Strikers

"The Starhawks see themselves as clearly superior to the average DreadBall team, but that doesn’t mean they aren’t above bending the rules – or just cheating! – to gain any advantage possible"

149442.name: The Exodus
149442.description:
This game recreates the journey of the Book of Exodus, wherein Moses was called upon by the Lord to lead his people from slavery under the Pharaoh of Egypt and guide them to Canaan, the Promised Land.

This game is for two players, one as Moses, the other as the Pharaoh.

Moses must safely lead his people across the Red Sea, while the Pharaoh must stop him.

This is a strategy game, the winner determined by placing road tiles strategically and effectively.

149443.name: Enigmata 2: Genu's Revenge
149443.description:
User Summary

Enigmata 2 is much more refined than its predecessor and offers several novel capabilities. You will select your initial spaceship among a choice of three and experience intense space battle in a series of levels. Upgrades, as well as gold, may be gathered when you destroy enemies. At the end of every level there is a much more powerful boss to beat. Also, you can replay any level for the purpose of gaining extra gold.

During the course of the game you will have the chance to improve your vessel by visiting the shop and buying various useful items, skills, missiles or even a new ship. For example, you can improve your ship's armor and shields, improve your ship's speed, assign nanobots that will automatically repair it when damaged and many more.

149444.name: Shootout in Silver Creek
149444.description:
Shootout in Silver Creek is an entertaining and fast-paced dice and card game.

Take a trip back to the old days of The Wild West and try your hand at running the town of SILVER CREEK. The fight for Silver Creek ain't fer yer average cowpoke. You and your gang are not alone in eyeing the possibilities of the town. So now, the down and the dirty fight has begun in earnest, where all bets are off!

The game offers many opportunities to be a real outlaw: fighting, brawling, shooting, robbery and hanging are a small part of what your gang has to go through to claim the prize that is Silver Creek.

You are divided into two bands of outlaws, fighting each other using cards played each turn. On your turn, you can play both a single Instant Card and a single Shooting Card. The Instant Cards offer a variety of special effects, while the Shooting Cards allows you to roll the dice and see if you wound your target! Every outlaw begins the game at 10 health, and if you ever run out you're out of the game.

When there is only one gang left standing, they gain control of Silver Creek and win the game. Good luck cowboy.

149445.name: Dreamcast Mouse
149445.description:
Dreamcast supported a mouse as well as a keyboard, which were useful when using the included web browser (fully functional), and also supported by certain games such as The Typing of the Dead, Quake 3, Phantasy Star Online and Railroad Tycoon 2. Other games such as REZ offered undocumented mouse support.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dreamcast Mouse", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

149447.name: Dictator of the Sea
149447.description:
Dictator of the Sea is about a battle between navy and pirate.

Perform one of the three actions below. As soon as the action is done, your opponent begins the next turn.
1. Select one face down Board tile on the board and flip it face up.
2. If a tile from your side (Navy or Pirate), the Whale tile, or the Shark tile is face up on the board, activate one of these units.
3. Spend Treasure to bribe an opponent's unit. Replace one of your opponent's units with your own unit.

Game ends when
1. If one side no longer has any units on the board
-> The player who still has units on the board wins. This player wins even if all his or her units are face down.
2. If 10 turns pass after all tiles are revealed
-> Add all the ranks of captured enemy tiles and the ranks of any of your remaining units on the board to determine your score. The player with the highest score wins. Equal scores means a tie.

149448.name: Xploder
149448.description:
From the Wikipedia:

Xploder is a brand of game cheats and multimedia devices for games consoles, similar to Action Replay. Xploder products have been released for PS2, PSone, PSP, Xbox, GameCube, N64, Game Boy, Game Boy Advance, PC and others. Support for the PS3, Xbox 360 and Nintendo Wii started in 2006-2007. Newer versions for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 allow users to download saved games from the Internet.

Utilizing the Xploder disc for the original PlayStation, users have found it possible to boot backup or copied versions of their games.

149449.name: Arcade Power Stick
149449.description:
User Summary

The Arcade Power Stick is an arcade stick peripheral for the Sega Genesis (though is also compatible with other consoles/computer that rely on DE-9 ports).

149450.name: 6 Button Arcade Stick
149450.description:
User Summary

The Arcade Power Stick II is an arcade stick peripheral for the Sega Mega Drive (though is also compatible with other consoles/computer that rely on DE-9 ports). It has 6 button instead of the 3 button previous version. It was called 6 Button Arcade Stick in North America, Arcade Power Stick II in Europe and Arcade Power Stick 6B in Japan.

149452.name: Rescue Mission
149452.description:
User Summary

Rescue Mission is a shooting game developed and published by Sega for the Sega Master System. It requires the Light Phaser peripheral.

From the back of the box:

Your friends are trapped behinf enemy lines. They're wounded and need your help to escape. You're taking the medics in... on a dangerous rescue mission.

149453.name: Scramble Spirits
149453.description:
Scramble Spirits is a Vertical Scrolling Shooter released for the arcade by Sega in 1988. It was ported to the Master System the same year, then to other home consoles and computers in 1990.

The player starts out with a propelled plane that can fire air-to-air twin machine guns and air-to-ground rockets. These weapons are used for destroying waves of enemy planes and ground and sea units. The main plane is destroyed by one hit. If a certain enemy is destroyed the player can collect a comrade fighter to fight alongside the main plane. Up to two comrade fighters can be collected. The comrade fighters can be assigned to fight in the air to fire bullets or they can be assigned to fight at low altitude to fire air-to-ground rockets. The comrade fighters can also be launched to do a kamikaze attack explosion against the enemy. After kamikaze attacks, the comrade fighters are retrievable, but they are lost if they are shot or crash into an enemy. In some areas of certain stages, the player will fly at a lower altitude armed with only twin machine guns and shooting down parked planes and turrets and can take a limited amount of damage from multiple shots and crashes. At the end of each stage, the player must destroy a boss vehicle to proceed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Scramble Spirits", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

149454.name: Marksman Shooting / Trap Shooting / Safari Hunt
149454.description:
User Summary

Marksman Shooting / Trap Shooting / Safari Hunt is a compilation of Marksman Shooting & Trap Shooting and Safari Hunt, developed and published by Sega, for the Sega Master System.

149455.name: Covert Ops: Nuclear Dawn
149455.description:
Covert Ops: Nuclear Dawn, otherwise known as Chase the Express (チェイス・ザ・エクスプレス Cheisu Za Ekusupuresu), is a video game created by Sugar and Rockets for the PlayStation, and released in 2000. On March 16, 2000 Activision announced that they had acquired the North American publishing rights to Sony Computer Entertainment's Japanese action-adventure game, Chase The Express. The game was then renamed Covert Ops: Nuclear Dawn for the North American market.

The player controls Lieutenant Jack Morton of NATO, the sole survivor of a terrorist strike on the Blue Harvest, an armored train. He is aided by Christina Wayborn throughout the game, the French ambassador's bodyguard and the NATO council. Traveling around the various carriages of the train, the player must defeat the terrorists, find the French ambassador, and prevent the terrorists from using a nuclear weapon.

The game is a third-person shooter, with other elements including puzzle solving, key searching, stealth and, at several points, driving the train. The game is divided into levels which take place on each carriage of the train, one such carriage may require the player to find key A that opens door B, while another could lead to a boss battle before disarming a bomb. The story here is not totally linear, events can change the entire game's course. The player can use hand-to-hand combat or ranged combat using a variety of weapons. Weapons can be customized using parts obtained throughout the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Covert Ops: Nuclear Dawn", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

149456.name: Mega Games 2
149456.description:
User Summary

Mega Games 2 is a compilation released for the Sega Mega Drive only in Europe in 1993. It was the second of three similar compilations, and was only distributed with Sega Mega Drive II consoles.

Games Included:

Golden Axe
Streets of Rage
The Revenge of Shinobi

149457.name: Mega Games 6 Vol. 2
149457.description:
User Summary

Mega Games 6 Vol. 2 is a compilation of six Sega Mega Drive games, distributed with some Mega Drive II consoles in 1995.

Games Included:

Alien Storm
Columns
Super Hang-On
Super Monaco GP
Super Thunder Blade
World Cup Italia '90

149458.name: Classic Collection
videogamecompilation: Alex Kidd in the Enchanted Castle
149458.description:
User Summary

Compilation of four Sega Mega Drive games distributed exclusively in Europe in 1996. It includes:

Alex Kidd in the Enchanted Castle
Altered Beast
Flicky
Gunstar Heroes

149459.name: Assaultous
149459.description:
Assaultous is a two-player strategy game in which you take the role of a Commander leading your army to defeat the enemy. To do that, you may need to expand your territory to gain more resources as
quickly as possible — or you may want to attack like lightning before your opponent can prepare his defenses. Everything depends on your decision!

On a turn, you roll a die and possibly gain resources, then you perform actions in whatever order you like: moving pieces up to twice a turn, purchasing and placing pieces or barracks, purchasing or playing a tactics card, or using the port. If you remove the opponent's Commander from play or take control of his capital, then you win.

149460.name: FIFA 95
149460.description:
User Summary

Football game developed by Extended Play Productions and published by Electronic Arts. It is the second licensed FIFA video game, following FIFA International Soccer and was the first to start the annual naming trend which continues to this day. It was only released on the Sega Mega Drive and Sega Game Gear.

FIFA 95 was the first soccer game to feature licensed clubs from several different international leagues, like the Major League (USA), Premier League (UK) and the Bundesliga (Germany).

It also offers a four-player mode using Electronic Arts' "4-Way-Play" device.

From the back of the box:

What's new in FIFA Soccer 95? Over a dozen new features, including:
- Injuries affecting players during a match and season
- 11 tournaments including Winners Cup and Nations Cup
- Reverse angle replay
- Battery backup to save tournaments and league positions
- Penalty shootouts
- Over 200 club and national teams including 8 national leagues
- Faster gameplay, faster passing and new volley shots
- Smarter computer players and goalies
- Powerful headers - for passing and scoring opportunities
- Set play free kicks

149461.name: Sega Worldwide Soccer 97
149461.description:
User Summary

Sega Worldwide Soccer 97 is a football game developed by Team Aquila and published by Sega. It's the third game of the saga after Victory Goal and Victory Goal '96, and is known as Victory Goal Worldwide Edition in Japan.

The game is not licensed by FIFA so cannot use real team or player names, however it attempts to stick as close as possible to the 1996 football season and allow users to rename players should they see fit.

The game was re-released for Windows PCs in 1997 under the title of Sega Worldwide Soccer PC.

149462.name: War-8}!
videogamecompilation: The Home Entertainment Shareware Collection: Vol. 6: Simulation Shareware Games
149462.description:
User Summary

War-8}! is a two player, shareware game similar to Scorched Earth and Worms. It was written in 1990 by Jake Firth and was his first shareware game.

Both players have five tanks which are dropped onto a computer generated 2D landscape. The object of the game is to score points by destroying all the opponents tanks and optionally the buildings that populate the landscape.

When it's their turn each player selects one of their tanks and a weapon. Aiming the weapon is an exercise in hand/eye co-ordination. The game provides two circles at the top of the screen. The first has a rotating arm that sets the direction of the shot while the second has coloured segments that indicate the power of the shot. While these are being selected they are mirrored in the game area which makes things just a tad easier. Once the player has chosen each of these the weapon is fired and hopefully does some damage.
The weapons available are a rocket propelled grenade, an amplified light pulse, and two forms of missile.

Unlike other games of this type, Worms for example, there's no wind or weather to alter the trajectory.

149464.name: Strike Fighters 2: North Atlantic
149464.description:
Strike Fighters 2 North Atlantic is a jet air-combat game set in hypothetical Cold War Soviet invasion of Iceland. The player flyable aircraft include the F-14 Tomcat and A-7 Corsair II.

The campaign is set in a 1979 hypothetical "Cold War gone Hot" scenario - what if the Soviet Union had decided to invade West Germany in 1979? The key to Soviet victory in Europe rests in the capture of Iceland and its vital strategic US base located there. With the Soviets in control of Iceland, the NATO forces would not be able to contain the Soviet Northern Fleet, and the American reinforcement fleets would not be able to reach Europe.

Join the US Navy and USS Nimitz Carrier Battle Group sent to reinforce the Iceland defense, protect the carrier from Soviet long-range bombers, and strike the Kiev battle group of the Soviet Northern Fleet!

The game is designed for Windows 7/Vista with a DX10 capable video card. It can be merged with other games in the series (Strike Fighters 2, Strike Fighters 2 Vietnam, Strike Fighters 2 Europe, and Strike Fighters 2 Israel) for additional aircraft, maps, missions, and campaigns.

Player Flyable Aircraft

F-14A Tomcat
A-7E Corsair II




AI Aircraft
A-6E Intruder, EA-6B Prowler, E-2C Hawkeye, F-4E Phantom II, MiG-21 "Fishbed", MiG-23/27 "Flogger", Yak-38 "Forger", Tu-16 "Badger", Tu-22 "Blinder", Tu-22M "Backfire", Tu-95 "Bear", An-12 "Cub"

Source: The Publisher Website.

149465.description:
A free promotional demonstration version of ZnajZnak. This mini-version is distributed free at Polish boardgame conventions.

In standard ZnajZnak there are 132 cards. In this free demo version, there are only 10 cards. Each of them presents 12 different symbols concerning the contemporary history of Poland. If you take a closer look at any two cards, you'll find out that they contain only one common character. The aim of a player is to notice the character on two other cards on the table and to tell its name as fast as possible. If the player succeeds to do that, he/she passes his/her card to another player. If he/she does not know the name of the character, he/she turns the card, reads the definition of the symbol, puts a new card on the table, and the game goes on. The winner is the person who first gets rid of all the cards in hand.
149465.name: ZnajZnak: Kieszonkowy

149466.name: Strike Fighters Attack
149466.description:
User Summary

3rd in the series, this game is based on jet fighter combat during the Cold War era (1954 to 1979 in the game).

However, where the first 2 games are dog fighting games, this game is specifically about ground attacking. The game features planes like the A-4, F-5, Harrier Jump Jet and of course the A-10. Succesful missions mean weapon and plane upgrades.

149468.name: Festival of Wolves
149468.description:
From Introduction:

Festival of Wolves is intended for a group of four to six Dragon Age characters with a decent mix of abilities to handle the various scenes – combat, exploration and roleplaying – in this adventure. It can work for larger or smaller groups, or different balances of abilities, with some modification.

A number of alternatives exist to making the characters work for the merchant, which is the easiest way to get the characters involved. The city of Highever is a large one and holds within it many important groups and individuals for which the characters could work, all of which would have clear motives for rooting out the Custodians. The characters could just as easily be caught up in these events without being employed by the merchant or other party, instead choosing to undermine the Custodians for any number of reasons ranging from potential reward or moral justification. If the characters are from Highever, it is quite possible that one of their friends or family members has joined the Custodians of the Wolf, thus giving the characters a personal stake in the adventure.

149469.name: The Secret of Eastvale
149469.description:
From Introduction:

The party has traveled for several days and come across the small village of Eastvale where the villagers give them a less than warm welcome.

Jorg the local shopkeeper sneaks into the party's room and pleads for their help. He explains to that a Witch of the Wilds has placed the village under a spell and even kidnapped Ardnis, his only daughter. He begs the party to help him and is willing to pay them with them a few items he has managed to acquire.

Any investigations around the village offer little light on the situation and only make the party more suspicious or at least confirm that something odd is going on. After this, they should decide to head into the woods and face off with the witch.

149470.name: Gemstone Companion
149470.description: Gemstone Companion is a supplement to the Gemstone Fantasy Miniature System that expands the original game rules to include a point-buy system, new terrain rules, two new hero types (assassins and priests), six new scenarios, 47 new spells and prayers, 17 sample non-player characters, and 32 new creature entries. Three new optional rules are also included, along with errata to the core rulebook.

149471.name: Gemstone Adventures
149471.description:
Gemstone Adventures expands the Gemstone Fantasy Miniature System to include rules for guiding adventuring parties into monster-haunted dungeons in search of fame and fortune.

The supplement describes 10 new hero types, 10 sample villains, 17 sample adventuring parties, 23 new spells and prayers, five new scenarios, new terrain rules for doors and treasure chests, advice on setting up and using a dungeon environment in Gemstone, and rules for building campaigns and advancing heroes.

The book comes with a cut-apart insert containing 96 encounter cards and 140 treasure and other counters.

149472.name: Karaokards
149472.description:
Karaokards is a new, fun, social card game, inspired by karaoke and based on the songs in your head. It offers two completely different ways to play, both based around playing cards that describe elements of a song.

One ruleset enables a traditional card game, gathering friends around a table (and can involve drunken singing, but doesn't have to). Players are dealt five cards. Each card contains two "clues" to a song -- for example "Artist begins with B" or "Genre: Rock". In each turn players play a card and build on a central tower of these clues, defining a song (of the player's choice, which may be switched turn by turn). As the tower gets bigger so it becomes harder and harder to find a song that matches all the clues. If a player cannot play a card they pass; the winner of the round is the last player able to play a card, and they score the number of cards in the tower as points.

The other game is something completely new: a game for teams or individuals to play during karaoke. Players are dealt five cards. Again, each card contains two "clues" to a song, but this time the players must combine as many cards as they can within their own hand to come up with a song to sing. Once they've chosen a song they add it to the playlist. When it's their turn to sing they announce the clues they chose and score points for each card they managed to use. During the song, other players may "duet" and score points for their own cards that match their song. When the song is finished players who have sung refresh their hands from the draw pile.

The winner is the player who has scored the most cards when the draw pile has been exhausted and the playlist completed.

149473.description:
Sound the alarm! A huge Tornado! is wreaking havoc on the outskirts of Tornadoville, USA! Rescuers from the elite Tornado! Rescue Unit have been sent to help. You are one of these Rescuers. Get ready to clear debris and free family members from the rubble, but beware the Tornado! Its particular brand of cyclonic evil can block you from finding people in need. Who will be the best Rescuer? Only time will tell!

In Tornado!, two players take turns as the Rescuer and as the Tornado! As the Rescuer, players will flip over cards and remove debris while hunting for and saving trapped family members to earn points. But the Tornado! player will attempt to block the Rescuer’s every move by throwing cubes onto the playing field. Not only can the Tornado! keep the Rescuer from scoring points, it can force the Rescuer to score points for the Tornado!
149473.name: Tornado!

149474.name: Patriot Command
videogamecompilation: The Home Entertainment Shareware Collection: Vol. 6: Simulation Shareware Games
149474.description:
User Summary

Patriot Command is a shareware game for one or more players, it is based on the classic arcade game Missile Command.

The player has a number of cities along the bottom of the screen together with two missile sites. They are faced with successive waves of incoming warheads which they must destroy to protect their cities. They achieve this by targeting their limited supply missiles so that they detonate close enough to the incoming warheads so that the blast radius will encompass and destroy them.

In addition to standard warheads the player also faces stealth warheads that are both harder to see and harder to destroy together enemy aircraft that fly across the screen at high altitude.

The objective is to destroy incoming warheads and score as many points as possible before the cities are destroyed at which point the game is over.

The game is mouse controlled, moving the mouse targets the incoming rockets while the left & right buttons fire missiles from the left & right missile sites. It has


five skill levels,
for slow computers it can be customised to use square blasts rather than the more computationally intensive round ones,
it supports multiplayer hot-seat gaming where typically each player plays for five minutes before handing over to the next 'commander'.
multiple backgrounds supplied with the game and more were available from the developer

149475.name: Birthright Campaign Setting Rulebook
149475.description:
User summary

The BRCS (short for Birthright d20 Campaign Setting Rulebook) contains the conversion to the d20 System of the Birthright setting, originally published by TSR for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons in 1995.

The rulebook contains the conversion of both the RPG and its setting from AD&D second edition rules to D&D third edition rules; successively, chapter 1 (Characters) and 2 (Blood and Regency) have also been updated to D&D 3.5 edition.

This fan conversion was made with permission of Wizards of the Coast and made available as a free download on the (then-) official WotC-sponsored fan website www.birthirght.net.

Summary:
- Chapter 1: Characters
- Chapter 2: Blood and Regency
- Chapter 3: Magic
- Chapter 4: Gods and Religion
- Chapter 5: Ruling a Domain
- Chapter 6: Armies and Warfare
- Chapter 7: Realm Magic
- Chapter 8: Outside the Lines
- Chapter 9: Creatures
- Credits
- Glossary
- Index

149476.name: Dragon Hack (Playtest Draft)
149476.description:
From Introduction:

The following is a collection of new, home-brewed material for use with the Adventure Game Engine by Green Ronin Publishing. This book uses a new fantasy class talents to allow players to model their characters after the familiar race and class archetypes of more traditional fantasy role-playing games such as the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game from Paizo Publishing.

149477.name: The Shadow Bloom
149477.description:
From Introduction:

In The Shadow Bloom, the player characters (PC’s) become aware that something has afflicted one or more of the group’s beloved animal companions (AC‘s). Despite the character’s best efforts, the mysterious affliction proves wholly resistant to both magical and mundane means of healing, forcing the PC’s to desperately seek out the most ancient of healing arts in hopes of curing their pets, who are wasting away in agony before their very eyes.

If the PC’s do not have animal companions, they can still play this module by being enlisted to help an NPC with a pet for the same purpose. The difference being that they get fully paid if they save the animal and it would be less agonizing and personal to them.

Either through research at the likes of a prominent University or in consulting many a healer, it soon becomes clear that their only hope lies in a rare relative of a wild flower, the shadow bloom. What’s worse is that the shadow bloom only grows in the most ancient and dense of woodlands, where little light has ever penetrated.

149478.name: Friends in Low Places
149478.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes meeting up with old friends in Serenity View is cause for celebration, but not this time. Over drinks, you and your Crew discover that Monty's new wife Daisy has gone missing. Worse, your pal thinks that Virgil Morningstar, a Guild trader with a heap of Alliance connections, had something to do with her disappearance. By the time you find out Daisy ain't the only one who's vanished, you and your Crew'll be neck-deep in trouble and hard-pressed to find your way out of it. Thing is, if you do unravel this little mystery, you'll claim a big reward and be heroes to boot.

149479.name: Villain Gazette Volume 1, Issue 4
149479.description:
From publisher blurb:


For Great Victory, Great Villains!

Sometimes, you just need stuff to beat up. Here, in the Villain Gazette, we provide a villain, their minions, and some cool gear for both sides to use. In this issue:

Space Pirate K'rinn Sojarr!
K'rinn's minions, the Crew Unbreathing!
Stats for K'rinn's starship, the Betrayal!
BONUS: Starship components for use with the The Victory System Equipment Manual!




See the villain's stats, learn their secrets, and prepare to deploy them on PCs in need of conflict. Includes the Redeemability Scale rating of the villain (so you know if they can be salvaged), and Adventure Seeds for bringing the villain into YOUR campaigns!

149480.name: Exotic Encounters: Cyclopes
149480.description:
From publisher blurb:

This particular installment of Exotic Encounters focuses on the cyclops. These terrible, one-eyed monsters have plagued human imagination since antiquity, and, in some recent campaign settings, are depicted as having ancient roots themselves, and being the descendants of a mighty empire of diviners, which fell long ago. The first cyclops in this book, the baleye cyclops (CR 9) represents a cyclops that took a different path, honing his eye for use with evocation, not divination, which can fire deadly rays from his eye, and which is vulnerable to attacks made against his eyes. The second cyclops, the cyclops brute (CR 12) is more typical of modern interpretations of cyclopes as large, hulking, stupid creatures. Larger than his kin, the cyclops brute is truly vicious in combat, and can crush his foes into the ground with a terrible foot stomp. Finally, the cyclops seer (CR 15) represents a cyclops who has tapped into the strong divination powers of his ancestors, and who can see the world for what it truly is, as well as influence the future with ease, making him a terrible foe to face.

149481.name: Sleepy Hollow
149481.description:
From publisher blurb:

"A drowsy, dreamy influence seems to hang over the land, and to pervade the very atmosphere."

With these words Washington Irving introduced the world to the tiny town of Sleepy Hollow and forever changed the literary world. Now revisit this tiny hamlet and its most famous residents with Sleepy Hollow! This 30-page source book is designed for use with Labyrinth Lord (and other old-school fantasy role-playing games) and inside you'll find all kinds of resources for your campaign!

The full text of the original short story "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow" by Washington Irving
Labyrinth Lord compatible statistics for the classic characters including Ichabod Crane, Katrina Van Tassel, and of course The Headless Horseman!
A new 14-level class, the Scholar, for use in your old-school fantasy role-playing game!
Complete firearms rules to bring your game into the colonial era!
Brand new monsters, straight out of the legends of old!
New magic items, some powerful and others cursed!
Adventure ideas to start your own Sleepy Hollow themed OSR game!

149482.name: The Little Book of Dungeons Volume I
149482.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within this (the first) volume of The Little Book Of Dungeons you will find nine grey-scale dungeon maps ready to be populated with a host of traps and foes for your players to overcome.

Each of the maps are 35 x 50 squares in size (175 ft. x 250 ft. if using a scale of one square equals five feet) and are ideal for the busy GameMaster who doesn't have time to design his/her own.

So, whether these maps be used to represent the long abandoned halls of a lost civilisation, or a thriving subterranean city, this booklet offers the GameMaster a variety of dungeon maps to get the adventure started!

149483.name: The Little Book of Dungeons Volume II
149483.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within this (the second) volume of The Little Book Of Dungeons you will find nine grey-scale dungeon maps ready to be populated with a host of traps and foes for your players to overcome.

Each of the maps are 35 x 50 squares in size (175 ft. x 250 ft. if using a scale of one square equals five feet) and are ideal for the busy GameMaster who doesn't have time to design his/her own.

So, whether these maps be used to represent the long abandoned halls of a lost civilisation, or a thriving subterranean city, this booklet offers the GameMaster a variety of dungeon maps to get the adventure started!

149484.name: The Little Book of Dungeons Volume III
149484.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within this (the third) volume of The Little Book Of Dungeons you will find nine grey-scale dungeon maps ready to be populated with a host of traps and foes for your players to overcome.

Each of the maps are 35 x 50 squares in size (175 ft. x 250 ft. if using a scale of one square equals five feet) and are ideal for the busy GameMaster who doesn't have time to design his/her own.

So, whether these maps be used to represent the long abandoned halls of a lost civilisation, or a thriving subterranean city, this booklet offers the GameMaster a variety of dungeon maps to get the adventure started!

149485.name: The Little Book of Dungeons: Megadungeon Level 1
149485.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Little Book of Dungeons : Megadungeon Level 1 is a map-pack by Crooked Staff Publishing that depicts the layout of a massive dungeon level that can be used on its own, as part of a multilevel dungeon system, or even split into smaller adventure locations.

THIS PRODUCT INCLUDES:

A 69 page pdf booklet containing…

An overview map that depicts the general layout of the entire dungeon level. This map also shows how the dungeon is split into * 29 smaller (more manageable) areas.
29 colour maps that depict each area of the dungeon in a little more detail.
Several player handout maps that the GM may like to have the players discover either before or during the course of their adventures.




62 Image Files

All of the area maps are also provided as high-res jpg images, as well as separate images optimised for use with virtual tabletops.




29 Battlemaps

Each of the area maps have also been supplied as miniatures scale pdfs so that they can be used as impromptu battle-mats should the need arise.




A Large Postermap

A huge, full colour, 300 dpi, postermap of the entire dungeon has also been provided in both jpg and pdf formats.

149486.name: The Little Book of Dungeons: Geomorphs
149486.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within this booklet you will find over seventy geomorph-style dungeon maps that will allow you to build good old-fashioned dungeon layouts (be they large or small) for your players to explore.

149487.name: The Little Book of Dungeons: Cave Geomorphs
149487.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within this booklet you will find over seventy geomorph-style cave maps that will allow you to build a wide variety of underground tunnels and caverns for your players to explore.

149488.name: East Eyrie Fortress Map-pack
149488.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this map pack you will find more than forty maps that depict the general layout of all the major structures within the great elven fortress of East Eyrie.

All of the maps have been presented in a semi-modular fashion so that they can be used to represent a wide variety of different buildings within any fantasy/medieval fortification - thus allowing GMs to utilise these maps in whatever manner (or campaign setting) they see fit.

In addition, a brief history has also been included to provide a little background information relevant to the Age of Shadow campaign setting (for those games where it is intended to be used as such), though this has been kept purposely brief (and system neutral) so as to not impede on this product's primary function as a map-pack.

User note: this is intended for use with the Age of Shadow campaign setting.

149489.name: Campaign Map 1: The Northern Kingdom
149489.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product features a large (A2 size), colour map of The Northern Kingdom from the Age of Shadow campaign setting.

However, a version of the map with all of the text/labels removed has also been included - thus allowing you to use the map as a starting point for creating your own home-brew setting* (with place names of your own devising) if that is your preference.

Note that each version of the map (i.e. labelled and unlabelled) is provided in the following formats:

A pdf file with the map split into four pages (for ease of printing)
A pdf file containing the whole map (A2 size)
A 300 dpi image file of the whole map

149490.name: Encounters in the Northlands
149490.description:
From publisher blurb:

Encounters in the Northlands is a collection of adventures and encounters for use with the (free) Age of Shadow fantasy role-playing game. Within its pages you will find the following four scenarios:

The Enchanted Forest
The Enchanted Forest covers rules for traversing areas of accursed woodland, and features a number of different (and often treacherous) encounters that can be had within.

The Shadowstone
A traditional style of adventure that pits the adventurers against fearsome undead creatures in a dungeon-style encounter.

Aleglin & Elmina
This is a scenario in which an elven lord has returned home after long years of imprisonment, only to discover that agents of the Enemy have proceeded him.

Mathgar Ruins
Mathgar Ruins is not an adventure in an of itself, but rather a fully detailed encounter location that the GM can tailor to his/her own quests and adventures.

Also included in this product are a number of VTT maps (scaled at 50 pixels per square), as well as miniatures-scaled *battle-maps, for most of the encounter locations found within this booklet.

(Note that these battle-maps are not intended to be comparible to high resolution dungeon tiles, but rather a simple and effective way of transforming the maps from this booklet into miniatures scaled battlemats (should the need arise).)

149491.name: Mummy: the Curse Ready Made Characters
149491.description:
User summary:

Ready made characters for Mummy: the Curse as well as chronicle seeds for what you can do with them, and a setting they can be based out of.

149492.description:
Speculation Queenie 1: New Action and Movement Tiles, a mini-expansion for Speculation, can be used individually or in combination with any other expansions for the game.

This expansion consists of twelve action tiles and twelve movement tiles that can replace or be added to the tiles in the base game. Although which action tiles to add or replace is left up to the players, the expansion provides three recommended scenarios. The new actions include the forced passing of one card to another player, ignoring a bank holiday card, accrual of interest, payment of tax, forced purchases, forced sales, and dividends.
149492.name: Speculation Queenie 1: New Action and Movement Tiles

149493.name: 子育てドラゴン
149493.description:
子育てドラゴン, which translates to "child-rearing dragon" was published in the doujinshi magazine つぎはぎたより in 2007, which was available in a PDF version for international download shopping from after 2008 until 2013.

In the game, the players take on the roles of dragon mothers who are stuck in human form until their respective child has reached adulthood or died (the latter does not occur in the game). Therefore, challenges have to be overcome by the child or the mother-child combination. Being published in an RPG doujinshi, the game has a lot of flavor text/descriptions.

The players decide when to rest or when to move to a different location (from a set of 6 locations), but otherwise is dependent on the luck of the roll. Each turn (defined as 10 years), unless the mother is resting, a die is rolled to determine the needs of the child and the mother then has to match or come within 1 of that die result. Success leads to a roll on a positive event table (modified by the care attribute/skill) while failure leads to a roll on the risky event table for the current location (which are often but not always negative events). In addition, after handling the events, the player may move the family to an adjacent location.
At the end of each turn, tiredness is checked to see whether the next turn is spent resting. When playing with 2+ players, players in the same location may attack each other to steal loot from each other.

The first player to lead the child to adulthood (which requires 20 units of loot) wins the game. Solo play is mentioned as an option, but no special rules are provided and some of the possible player powers are incompatible with solo play.

149494.description:
Speculation Mini Expansion 2: 7th and 8th Players, a mini-expansion for Speculation, can be used individually or in combination with any other expansions for the game. This expansion includes components to allow for up to eight players in the game, namely additional shares, money, and company cards.

In addition, each player now has a minus card in hand along with the company cards. Instead of laying down a company card at the start of the turn, a player can lay down a minus card. Before revealing which companies move during the turn, everyone who played a minus card reveals it, then secretly plays a company card or "Bank Holiday" card; this company moves backward on the movement track instead of forward, or one "Bank Holiday" card played by someone else is ignored.
149494.name: Speculation Queenie 2: 7th and 8th Players

149495.description:
The Firefly: The Game - Mal's Pretty Floral Bonnet promo consists of 1 card featuring Malcom from the Firefly television series created by Joss Whedon. It allows a player to ignore die rolls for attempts to capture Wanted Crew. Also it does not count towards a Crew's gear carrying limit (normally 1).

This promo was released by Think Geek as a bonus for ordering Firefly: The Game.
149495.name: Firefly: The Game – Mal's Pretty Floral Bonnet Promo Card

149496.description: Metallum:Psi is a mini-expansion for Metallum that consists of one promotional planet tile. Mix this tile along with the ones from the base game during step 1 of the game set-up. When using Psi, the active player switches the places of his Factory Ship with the opponent's Factory Ship.

149497.name: Solarmax
149497.description:
User Summary

You start out controlling a planet and a fleet of ships orbiting it. Your objective on each of the levels in the game is to move and colonize uninhabited or attack enemy planets. You complete a level once you manage to successfully obliterate the enemy and colonize all planets in the system.

149500.name: Desert Moon
149500.description:
User Summary

Your spaceship has crashed on a desert planet inhabited by hostile reptilian creatures. Your crew of five engineers must survive five days on onslaught. Wave after wave, the enemies seek to bury you in the desert forever. Strategic planning and careful use of your limited firepower may allow you to live and see another day. Can you make it to the end?
